Actualmente Dora tiene muy buenas ventas, pero a menudo debe renunciar a algunos pedidos de sus clientes por no tener los productos que solicitan; es por esto que Dora quiere comprar productos farmacéuticos para su negocio, de modo que pueda responder a todos los requerimientos de sus clientes, sin embargo, Dora no cuenta con el capital suficiente para acceder a la compra de esta mercancía, por lo que tiene la esperanza puesta en que un préstamo le permitirá acceder a la compra de productos farmacéuticos y surtir así su negocio para que sus clientes puedan encontrar todas sus necesidades satisfechas en su negocio.
Dora aspira a que de esta manera sus ventas aumenten considerablemente, y de este modo pueda brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y su esposo. Además de permitirle a sus hijos acceder a una educación universitaria que les permita en un futuro conseguir un empleo que sea bien remunerado.
texts.en:
Dora has been a hardworking woman her whole life. Thanks to that, she has been able to get ahead with her husband and their 2 children. Dora has always wanted her 2 children to have everything they need, so she works hard at her job every day.  

Dora has worked at different activities to generate income for her home. Before, she sold cell phones and did cell phone repairs, but the business didn't let her have enough income. That is why she opened a pharmacy that allows her to access more income. Because she and one  of her children knew the business, the pharmacy has been growing and getting more stable in the area. Thanks to her good service and the good quality of the products she offers, Dora has been able to attract customers and make her business well known.
 
At present, Dora has very good sales, but at times she has to turn down orders from customers because she doesn't have the products they are asking for. That is why Dora wants to buy pharmaceutical products for her business so that she can respond to all of her customers' needs. Nonetheless, Dora doesn't have enough capital to purchase the merchandise. She hopes that the loan will allow her to access the purchase of pharmaceutical products and thus stock her business so that her customers can find everything they need in her business. 

Dora hopes to increase her sales significantly in this way and offer a better quality of life to her children and her husband. She also wants to offer her children a university education that will allow them to find well paid jobs in the future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of pharmaceuticals so that her customers can find what they need in her pharmacy.

loans.name: Ivan De Jesus

texts.es:
Ivan ha sido una persona que ha pasado por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo, su lucha constante y su capacidad de superación, han hecho que salga adelante. Ivan es un padre soltero que tiene a su cargo su hijo de 17 años, pues la madre los abandonó hace un tiempo. Es por esto que Ivan trabaja fuertemente todos los días con el ánimo de generar los ingresos necesarios para su hogar, donde convive con su madre y su hijo.
Ivan se dedica al trabajo de la confección a terceros, actividad que ejerce desde hace aproximadamente 13 años. Gracias a esto, Ivan obtiene los ingresos suficientes para brindarles a su madre y a su hijo todo lo que necesitan.
Ivan actualmente ha tenido muy buenos pedidos de sus clientes, sin embargo, algunos los ha tenido que rechazar debido a que no cuenta con las máquinas suficientes para hacer dichos trabajos. Es por esto que Ivan pretende comprar una máquina recubridora que le permita atender estos pedidos de sus clientes que ha tenido que rechazar, sin embargo, Ivan no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar la máquina, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de la máquina recubridora, de modo que no tendrá que rechazar los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, que requieren de esta máquina para realizar el trabajo.
Ivan sueña con que su negocio le pueda brindar mejores ingresos, de modo que le permita tener una mejor calidad de vida a su madre y su hijo. 
Además, Ivan sueña con que su hijo pueda acceder a una educación universitaria de calidad, y poder así estar preparado para que en un futuro obtenga un empleo bien remunerado.
texts.en:
Ivan has been a person who has gone through a lot of adversity in life. Nonetheless, his constant struggle and his ability to overcome have helped him to get ahead. Ivan is a single father who is raising his 17 year old son, since the boy's mother abandoned them a long time ago. That is why Ivan works hard everyday to generate income for his home, where he lives with his mother and son. 

Ivan works making clothing for people. He has done this for approximately 13 years. Thanks to this, Ivan obtains enough income to offer his mother and his son everything they need.

At present, Ivan has very good orders from his customers. Nonetheless, he has had to turn some down because he doesn't have enough machines to do the jobs. That is why Ivan intends to buy an overlocking sewing machine because it will allow him to fill those orders that he has had to turn down. Nonetheless, Ivan doesn't have enough capital to buy a machine, so he hopes that a loan will offer him the possibility of being able to buy the overlocking sewing machine, so that he won't have to turn down customers' orders that need that machine. 

Ivan dreams of his business generating more income, allowing him to give his mother and son a better quality of life. In addition, Ivan dreams of his son being able to access a university education and thus be prepared to have a well paid job in the future.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine that will allow him to fill his customers' orders that need this machine.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 23 years old and he sells bananas to earn a living. He has been in the business for 5 years and describes his business environment as busy because many customers visit him daily. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy bananas.

loans.use: To buy bananas.

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Priscah is a resident of Kitale, Western Kenya, and a mother of six between the ages of 21 and 3 years. She has practiced farming for 6 years. Her farm produces milk, maize and beans, which are all sold within the local market.

Priscah has requested a second loan of 61,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow for 31,200 KES. She will also buy poultry birds at 30,000 KES to help her venture into poultry farming as well. She says the poultry business has a ready market in the area, but farmers shy away from it due to rampant poultry diseases. She says the additional dairy cow will help her family with milk for daily consumption and add into her income to meet other family needs.

Priscah says that the high costs of dairy feeds remain a challenge, especially during dry seasons.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow and buy poultry birds.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 28 years and he sells men's and women's jeans to earn a living. He has been in the business for 5 years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 10,000 Kenya Shillings to buy men's and women's jeans for resale.

loans.use: To buy men's and women's jeans for resale.

loans.name: Ndeye Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye Fatou est âgée  de 32 ans. Elle vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 2 et 10 ans. Elle s’active dan le secteur du commerce et  vend de la pate d’arachide depuis cinq ans. Elle a chois cette  activité dans le but d’éviter d’être  inactive. Et ce qui l’intéresse  le plus  c’est  la réalisation des  bénéfices  qu’elle peut engendrer. Elle  est membre  d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mars 2008. Elle a déjà remboursé un crédit  antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour renforcer son fond de roulement. Elle compte acheter de l’arachide en quantité assez importante pour en faire de la pate. Cette opération pourra l’aider à augmenter considérablement ses bénéfices et améliorer la condition de vie sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndeye Fatou is 32 years old and lives in Senegal. She is married and the mother of 3 children aged between 2 and 10. She is a small retailer and has been selling peanut butter for 5 years. She chose this work so that she could stay busy. The aspect she finds most interesting about the work is the realisation of potential profits.

She has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since March 2008 and has already repaid a previous loan. She is requesting a loan of 100 000 francs which will strengthen her working capital. She plans to buy a large quantity of peanuts that she can turn into peanut butter. This would allow her to considerably increase her profits and improve her family´s social living conditions.

loans.use: to buy peanuts which which to make peanut butter for resale.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana, who is 49 years old, is married and has five children ranging from twelve to twenty-five years. She describes herself as a responsible, ambitious and confident woman. Previously, she was involved in primary farming activities. For the past twenty years, she has been selling vegetables in an urban area to new and repeat customers. In addition, she sells maize and beans to increase her income. 

Her grocery retail business is faced with the problem of the perishability of the vegetables sold. She will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more tomatoes, potatoes, kale and onions for selling. Her dream and hope is to be a supplier of vegetables to local schools and hotels in the future.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, potatoes, kale and onions for selling.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is aged 37 and married with 5 children between the ages of 18 and 5 years. She currently carries out her farming in her home area of Kitale and produces maize, beans and milk for the local market. She has carried out farming for 8 consecutive years.

Jane has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the additional dairy cow will help improve her family's living standards by providing basic family needs. She aspires to own five hybrid dairy cows in future.

However, she notes that animal feeds are quite costly during dry seasons and limits the cows' output significantly.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a farmer and a resident of Kitale, Western Kenya. She is married with 4 children and has been farming for 8 years. Her farm is currently run with the help of one farmhand and produces milk and maize, which are both sold within the local markets.

Elizabeth has requested a loan of 46,800 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says this will boost her dairy farming business. Previously she had acquired a loan of 46,600 KES, which she used to venture into dairy farming. She adds that she has gained more experience in the dairy business and hopes the second loan will earn better returns.

She notes that animal diseases remain a daunting challenge to farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a mother of 3 who are between the ages of 17 and 9 years. She is age 53 and has been active in farming for over ten years, producing and selling maize, beans and milk. Besides farming, she runs a secondhand clothing business. She says farming helps her meet most of her family's basic needs, like education and the provision of meals for her children.

Margaret has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds in order to venture into the poultry farming business, too. She says there is a ready market for poultry birds and eggs, and she hopes the business will raise her family's living standards.

However, she laments the high cost of supplies and the unreliable rains.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en: Tobias is 29 years old and married with one child. He does tailoring to earn a living, and he has been in the business for 3 years. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his income in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in the business for 6 years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 10,000 Kenya Shillings to buy tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Oun is aged 58 and widowed with five children. She lives in a village in the Thmor Koul district of Cambodia. Out of her five children, she has two daughters dependent on her and still studying in a primary school. She earns a living through farming rice as a primary business and selling cakes as secondary. She has been in this business for three years. With her current business, she can earn around nine U.S. dollars per day, but is able to save only around US$3 daily. 

This is a first loan for Oun’s group with Kiva’s field partner, VisionFund. Her group consists of two members and she is leading this group to apply for a loan of KHR1,000,000 each. As the leader, she plans to use this entire loan to pay for labor to harvest her rice crop. With this loan, Oun hopes to earn more income to increase her business and also keep her daughters in school.

loans.use: To pay for labor to harvest her rice crop.

loans.name: Jesuwanon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUWANON est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Brigitte est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Brigitte est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Simon. Brigitte vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Brigitte mène comme activité depuis six ans environs la vente de plateaux d'œufs frais par le système de distribution. Cette activité lui permet de contribuer sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Brigitte s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Brigitte sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUWANON, un troisième crédit. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The group JESUWANON is made up of three people who live in the same area. This is the third time that the group is asking for the financial assistance of Alidé, in order to raise the level of their business activity. The representative of the group, named Brigitte, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Brigitte is forty-six years old and is married to a driver named Simon. Brigitte lives together with her husband and child. The couple has one child who is in school and in their care. The various expenses of the household are provided for by the couple. To manage this, Brigitte has run a business selling cartons of fresh eggs through a distribution system for around six years. This activity allows her to contribute to the needs of her family without great difficulty. Brigitte stocks up in a market in Benin. In seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her profits and revenue, Brigitte is asking for a third loan, together with the other members of the JESUWANON group. Their first two loans have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fresh eggs.

loans.name: Gbenonvi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONVI est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Valerienne Afiavi est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Valerienne Afiavi est âgée de 51 ans et vit au Bénin. Valerienne Afiavi n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Valerienne Afiavi ne vit plus avec son mari, et a deux enfants, tous scolarisés dont un est à sa charge. Valerienne Afiavi vit seule avec son enfant à charge et assure seule ses différentes charges. Depuis une quinzaine d'année, Valerienne Afiavi vend des produits divers (conserves, savons) et des tissus par le système de distribution ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Valerienne Afiavi sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONVI, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les quatre premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Gbenonvi group is made up of 4 people who all live in the same area. This is the 5th time the group is requesting a loan from ALIDé in order to be able to increase their level of business activity.

The group's representative, Valerienne Afiavi, is the woman in the picture with her hand raised. She is 51 years old and lives in Benin. She did not go to school. She is the mother of 2 children, both of whom have attended school. She no longer lives with her husband and is currently raising one child. She lives alone with her child and is solely responsible for their expenses.

Valerienne Afiavi has been selling various products - canned goods, soaps and fabrics - via the distribution system for around 15 years; this enables her to take care of her needs and those of her child. In order to be able to satisfy her customers and increase her turnover and revenue, Valerienne Afiavi is requesting, together with the other members of the Gbenonvi group, a 5th loan from ALIDé. They have fully repaid their first 4 loans.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soaps and fabrics.

loans.name: Mame Yacine

texts.fr:
Madame Mame Yacine fait parti des premières  clientes du guichet. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Son mari qui est maitre coranique, l’a toujours soutenu dans ses activités.
Cette activité qui consiste à vendre de la bouillie épaisse et du couscous dans le quartier ou elle loge, elle l’a démarré depuis 3 ans de cela. 
Avec le crédit elle va se ravitailler en mil : un sac,  et va acheter aussi du bois pour pouvoir faire la cuisson. 
Elle n’a pas de charges et s’occupe d’elle-même et à améliorer son commerce.
texts.en:
Madame Mame Yacine is one of her branch's first clients. She is married and a mother of family. Her husband, who is a teacher of the Koran, has always supported her in her activities.
This business, which she started three years ago, consists of selling thick porridge and couscous in the area where she lives.
With the loan, she will purchase fresh supplies of millet (one bag), and is also going to buy wood in order to cook. She does not have anyone to support, and takes care of herself and improving her business.

loans.use: to buy millet and wood to make couscous and porridge to be sold.

loans.name: Marème

texts.fr: Marème est  une femme qui vit avec ses quatre enfants. Son mari étant décédé depuis deux ans.Elle exporte des céréales locales transformées et des produits halieutiques qu'elle envoie à sa soeur établie au Maroc.En retour cette dernière lui envoie des tissus.Elle pratique cette activité depuis un an et parvient à générer des revenus assez consistants qui lui permettent de se prendre en charge et de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.Afin d'augmenter son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un prêt de 500000f pour acheter 05 cartons de couscous ordinaire, 05 cartons de "couscous en boulette", 05 cartons de farine de mil, 20 kg de poisson séché et 15 kg de poisson fumé.Son ambition est d'ouvrir une grande unité de transformation des produits agricoles dans sa localité.
texts.en:
Marème lives with her 4 children. Her husband died 2 years ago. Marème exports local processed cereals and halieutic products to her sister who lives in Morocco and who, in turn, sends her fabrics. She has been in this line of work for a year and manages to earn consistent enough revenues to allow her to take care of her and her children´s needs.

Marème is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs to increase her working capital. She will use the loan to buy 5 boxes of regular couscous, 5 boxes of "couscous en boulette" (couscous dumplings), 5 boxes of millet flour, 20 kg of dried fish and 15 kg of smoked fish. Her ambition is to open a large processing plant in which to process the local agricultural produce.

loans.use: to buy 5 boxes of regular couscous, 5 boxes of "couscous en boulette", 5 boxes of millet flour, 20 kg of dried fish and 15 kg of smoked fish.

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en:
Phat, who lives in a village in the Thmor Koul district, is 39 years old and married. She has three dependent children who are still in school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice as a main source of income. Sometimes they work for others for a fee to better feed the family. They have been in this business for five years. Phat earns nearly $9 per day from her current business. 

Phat and her partner are the first cycled clients with Kiva’s field partner, VisionFund. They are requesting a loan of KHR 500,000 each. As the leader, Phat will use the entire loan to pay for labor to harvest her dry season rice. She hopes to harvest the rice crops on time and sell them for a good profit to set aside for the future and also to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To pay for labor to harvest her dry season rice.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée, mère de 4 enfants dont les deux sont à l'école.Après avoir arrêté ses études en 2005, elle exerce un commerce de tissus, de bijoux et de sacs à main.Elle est appuyée par son mari qui lui écoule une partie de sa marchandise dans la ville ou il travaille.Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à certains de ses propres besoins de femme mais également de participer à la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de la famille.Pour renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un prêt de 500000 francs auprès de l'UIMCEC pour l'achat de 50 sacs en cuir et 5 rouleaux de tissu. Son ambition est de se lancer dans l'import - export.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married woman and the mother of 4 children, 2 of whom go to school. She stopped her studies in 2005 and started selling fabrics, jewellery and handbags. She is helped by her husband who sells some of her merchandise in the town he works in. The business allows her to take care of some of her own needs and also to contribute to the household maintenance expenses.

In order to increase her working capital, she is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs from UIMCEC with which she will buy 50 leather handbags and 5 rolls of fabric. Her ambition is to get involved in the import/export business.

loans.use: to buy 50 leather handbags and 5 rolls of fabric.

loans.name: Peng's Group

texts.en:
The breadwinner of his family, Peng is a 56-year-old father of six children. He lives in a village in the Moung Russey district of Cambodia. His family earns a living through farming rice twice per year. They have been in this business for nearly 43 years. His wife and children work at other plantations to gain additional income. 

Peng received a loan from VisionFund three years ago and he successfully repaid the loan. Since 2009, the loan has made Peng's living better. He now earns around $5 per day and is able to save around $2.50 each day. He is now leading a group of three members to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, Peng is going to use this loan to buy fertilizer for his dry-season rice. With this loan, he hopes to earn more income to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his dry-season rice.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Sandra es una persona reconocida entre sus familiares y amigos, por ser muy dedicada al bienestar de su hijo y el de sus padres. 
Con 33 años de edad, Sandra es una madre soltera cabeza de familia que debe velar por el bienestar de su hijo de 10 años, el cual afirma es la inspiración para trabajar arduamente todos los días en su negocio.
Con el ánimo de generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar, Sandra decidió montar una tienda de licores donde atiende gran cantidad de clientes y les ofrece productos como cervezas, aguardiente, ron, entre otros.
Sandra ha podido posicionar su negocio en el sector gracias a los buenos productos que ofrece y al buen servicio que presta, es por esto que sus clientes la tienen como un referente a la hora de consumir en el sector.
Sandra, con el ánimo de generar mayores ingresos para su familia, desea que su negocio se encuentre con más surtido de mercancía, además de cambiar algunas sillas que ya se encuentran en mal estado por el uso; sin embargo, Sandra se encuentra con un inconveniente que no le permite tener el capital suficiente para comprar estos productos, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de licores como son cervezas, aguardiente, ron, entre otros, y a la compra de unas nuevas sillas para amoblar su negocio, pues tiene unas sillas que ya se encuentran muy deterioradas.
Sandra tiene el sueño de que su hijo pueda acceder a una educación de calidad, por lo que quiere que su negocio le genere mayores ingresos para cumplir esto. Además, sueña con algún día poder tener su casa propia y desde la cual le pueda brindar a su hijo la mejor calidad de vida posible, y una estabilidad económica que le evite de pasar por las diferentes adversidades que ha pasado Sandra en su vida.
texts.en:
Sandra is well known among her friends and family because she looks out for the well-being of her son and parents.  She is 33 and a single mother who acts as head of family, looking out for her 10-year-old son who she says is her inspiration to work hard every day in her business.

In order to generate enough income to support her household Sandra decided to set up a liquor store where she attends to many customers, offering products such as beer, liquor, rum etc.

Sandra has been able to achieve her market share thanks to the quality products she offers along with good customer service.  Her customers consider her a leader within the industry. 

In order to generate more income for her family she wants to have a well-stocked business, and also change some of the chairs that are damaged.  The problem is that Sandra does not have enough capital to buy these products and so is requesting a loan to buy beer, liquor, rum, etc., and new chairs for her business.  The ones she has have become deteriorated.
 
Sandra's dream is for her son to get a quality education, so she wants to generate more income to make sure this is a possibility.  Also, in the future she wants to have her own home so she can give her son a better lifestyle and economic stability so he does not have to suffer the difficulties Sanda had in her life.

loans.use: To buy alcohol such as beer, liquor, rum, etc. for her business, and to buy chairs to replace damaged ones.

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond is 35 years old and married with three children. He runs a photocopy shop to earn a living. He has been in this business for three years and has employed one person. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Raymond has been able to expand his business. He hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a KES 50,000 loan to buy a photocopy machine.

loans.use: To buy a photocopy machine.

loans.name: Samut's Group

texts.en:
Samut is 43 years old and married with five children. She is a peasant who plants corn as her primary business to make a living. She supplements her income by selling grocery items such as soap, detergent, cake, candy, etc. She has been in this business for five years. 

This is a first loan for Samut’s group with Kiva’s field partner, VisionFund. Her group consists of herself and another female member who are applying for a loan of KHR 800,000 each. As the leader, Samut plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her corn healthfully and sell it for a good profit to earn a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a businessman who is married with two children. He owns a retail shop and sells sugar, tea leaves and maize flour to earn a living.

Nicholas has been in the business for four years. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a KES 20,000 loan to buy sugar, tea leaves and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, tea leaves and maize flour.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is 35 years old and the mother of three children. She runs a beauty salon to earn a living, and has been in this business for six years. She describes her business environment as busy because many customers visit her daily.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Carolyne has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of KES 42,000 to buy a hair dryer.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 27 years old and the mother of one child. She sells blouses and shirts to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and has employed one person. 

Grace does farming to earn extra income. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy blouses and shirts to sell.

loans.use: To buy blouses and shirts to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is engaged in agriculture. She keeps cattle. Anna lives with her mother, brother, brother's wife and children. 

Anna has been engaged in cattle-breeding for four years. Through this period she has sustained her mother and brother's family. 

Now Anna would like to expand her farm and develop agriculture. With the loan's help, Anna will purchase cattle. This will allow Anna to earn more income and develop her farm further.

loans.use: to pay for cattle.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 30 years old and married with one child. He sells sweaters, trousers and blouses to earn a living. He has been in this business for eight years and describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a KES 80,000 loan to buy sweaters, trousers and blouses for sale.

loans.use: To buy sweaters, trousers and blouses for sale.

loans.name: Hugo De Jesus

texts.es:
Hugo ha sido una persona muy trabajadora durante toda su vida, además de que es muy reconocido por siempre querer mejorar el bienestar de su familia.
Hugo, con 67 años de edad, se encuentra casado y es padre de 5 hijos, a los cuales les quiere brindar todo lo que necesitan. 
Hugo se ha desempeñado por más de 20 años en el negocio de las comidas rápidas, y ha variado sus ventas desde plátanos, papas, chicharrones, entre otros.
Hugo, actualmente trabaja en su carro de comidas rápidas, el cual ya se encuentra en un estado deplorable, por lo que sus clientes a menudo ya son reacios a comprar sus productos por la condición de su carro de comidas. Es por esto que Hugo aspira a poder comprar un nuevo carro de comidas rápidas, el cual le permita desempeñarse con mayor facilidad y no aleje los clientes de su negocio, sin embargo, Hugo no cuenta en la actualidad con el capital suficiente para comprarlo, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de comprar un nuevo carro de comidas, que le permita trabajar con mayor sanidad sus comidas rápidas, y sus clientes no se alejen por el deterioro de su herramienta de trabajo.
Hugo espera que con el cambio de su carro de comidas sus ventas aumenten considerablemente, y de esta manera pueda brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa y sus 5 hijos. Además, sueña con que sus hijos puedan acceder a una educación universitaria y tengan una estabilidad económica en un futuro, por lo que trabaja fuertemente para dejarles una buena fuente de ingreos.
texts.en:
Hugo has been a hard-working person all of his life.  Also, he is well-known for always wanting to improve his family’s well-being.  Hugo, age 67, is married and has five children; he wants to give them everything they need.

Hugo has worked in the fast food business for over 20 years.  He sells various foods such as bananas, potatoes, and “chicharrones” (pork rinds), among others.

The fast food cart that Hugo now works with is in deplorable shape.  His customers are frequently reluctant to buy his products because of the condition of his food cart.  That is why Hugo is hoping to be able to buy a new fast food cart.  This would allow him to work more easily, and it would not drive the customers away from his business.

However, Hugo does not now have enough capital to buy it.  That is why he hopes that a loan will give him the opportunity to buy a new food cart.  This will allow him to work with his fast food in a more sanitary manner.   Also, his customers will not go away because of the deterioration of his work tool.

Hugo hopes that with the change of his food cart his sales will increase considerably.  This way he will be able to give his wife and their five children a better quality of life.  Also, he dreams of his children being able to access a university education and of them having financial stability in the future.  That is why he works so hard in order to leave them with a good source of income.

loans.use: to buy a new fast food cart because the one he has now is in bad shape, and customers are leaving.

loans.name: Rodil Enrique

texts.es:
Rodil es una persona muy carismática que ha sido reconocido por su familia por siempre querer brindarles bienestar a las demás personas.
Rodil ha sido desde muy pequeño un buen trabajador, y se ha desempeñado en diferentes actividades. Gracias a un amigo que le enseñó la labor, Rodil ahora trabaja en la metalistería, actividad que le permite generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar, donde convive con su esposa. 
Rodil ha trabajado durante mucho tiempo como ayudante en un taller de metalistería, pero un día decidió independizarse y montó su propio taller. 
Desde entonces Rodil tiene su taller de metalistería donde tiene muy buenos clientes debido a su buen servicio y a la buena calidad que ofrece, y donde tiene muy buenos pedidos para realizar trabajos a sus clientes.
Actualmente Rodil tiene buenos pedidos de sus clientes, sin embargo, debido a que no posee la infraestructura completa para ofrecer el servicio completo a sus clientes, Rodil ve como no pueda contratar con sus clientes la fabricación de algunos productos. Es por esto que Rodil pretende acceder a la compra de una máquina rectificadora de cilindros que le permita tener los contratos de sus clientes, sin embargo, la máquina es muy costosa y Rodil apenas cuenta con aproximadamente el 60% de su valor. Por esto, Rodil tiene la esperanza de que un préstamo le permita acceder a la compra de la máquina rectificadora de cilindros y de esta manera pueda seguir teniendo todos los contratos con sus clientes.
Rodil sueña con que su negocio le genere grandes ingresos, de modo que le pueda mejorar la condición de vida que tiene su esposa actualmente, y también quiere que sus padres puedan obtener una mejor calidad de vida. 
Adicional a esto, Rodil sueña con tener su propia casa, donde pueda tener mayor privacidad con su esposa, y puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rodil is a very charismatic person who his family feels is always trying to help others.  Since he was very young he has always been a hard worker in different business activities.  Thanks to a friend who taught him the trade, Rodil now is involved in metalworks which allows him to generate enough income to cover household expenses for himself and his wife.

For many years he worked as a metal workshop assistant but decided to become independent and set up his own workshop.  Since then Rodil has been running his metal business and gaining many customers because of his quality work and customer service.  He receives many orders.

Currently, Rodil has many orders but does not have the infrastructure he would need to fill them, nor the resources to outsource the jobs.  So he wants to buy a cilinder grinding machine to attend to customer contracts.  The machine is very expensive and Rodil can barely cover 60% of the cost.  Therefore he is hoping to obtain a loan to buy the machine and fill customer orders.

Rodil's goal is for his business to generate a good income so he and his wife can have a better lifestyle.  He also wants his parents to have a better quality of life.

Also, Rodil hopes to have his own house so he and his wife can have more privacy.

loans.use: To buy a cylinder grinding machine to fill orders.

loans.name: Ovidio

texts.es:
Ovidio ha sido una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada en su vida, donde todos los ingresos que obtuvo mientras trabajó a temprana edad los ahorró y luego los invirtió para poder generar ingresos y progresar económicamente.
Ovidio, tiene un hijo y se encuentra separado de su madre, pues los abandonó hace un tiempo, y por tanto, Ovidio debe generar los ingresos suficientes para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar. 
Ovidio actualmente tiene una cafetería la cual arrienda para que otra persona la administre, y debido a esto, el administrador anterior le dejó el negocio en muy malas condiciones y con muchas deudas por pagar.
Es por esto que Ovidio requiere con urgencia pagar las deudas pendientes de su negocio, y arreglarle los daños causados, que son principalmente en el baño, sin embargo, Ovidio no cuenta actualmente con el capital suficiente para realizarlo, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le permitirá acceder al pago de las deudas del negocio las cuales las debe de pagar en un periodo de tiempo muy corto, y al arreglo de los enseres dañados, como son principalmente el baño, y algunos otros como vitrinas entre otros. 
Ovidio tiene la esperanza de que con el pago de sus deudas y el arreglo de los daños causados, pueda volver a rentar la cafetería y siga así recibiendo los ingresos necesarios para sostener los gastos de su hogar. 
Ovidio espera que su negocio le vuelva a dar buenos ingresos y de esta manera pueda permitirle a su hijo acceder a una carrera de educación universitaria, el cual lo pueda preparar para que en un futuro consiga un empleo bien remunerado y no tenga que sufrir las adversidades que ha sufrido Ovidio en su vida.
texts.en:
Ovidio has always been a dedicated, hard worker who has saved his money ever since he was young to invest and get ahead.

He has a son and is separated from his wife, who left some time ago.  Therefore, Ovidio must generate enough income to cover household expenses.  Currently, he has a coffee shop that he rents for another person to manage.  The previous manager left the business in a bad state with many unpaid debts.

Now Ovidio needs to pay off the pending debts urgently and make some repairs, especially in the bathroom.  But he does not have sufficient capital right now and is in need of a loan to pay off the short-term debts and repair the bathroom damages.  Some display cases also need repair.

Ovidio hopes that by paying off debt and fixing up the damages his coffee shop will become profitable again and he will make enough money to cover household expenses.

He hopes he can make a good income again and give his son a university education so he can get a good job in the future and not have to suffer the hardship Ovidio had in his life.

loans.use: To make repairs and pay urgent debts left by the previous manager.

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en:
Walaa, a 23-year-old married lady, has two daughters and one son. Her husband works with the military. 

A year ago Walaa started a small business so she can help in adding another source of income to the family so they can provide their kids with the best life, and save for their future. 

Walaa's retail business selling blankets to relatives, neighbors, and friends has been working so well till now, seeing the profit that she is making from the business has lead her to apply for a youth loan so she can increase the quantity she has of blankets and buy them at a wholesale price.

loans.use: to buy blankets at wholesale

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan, 42 years old, is a married woman. She has two sons and three daughters. The oldest is married.

Hanan is a teacher who insists that all of her kids get educated and register at the university. Her son Ahmad is 20 years old and an accounting student at one of the Jordanian Universities. Ahmad hopes that after graduation he can work in the banking field. For that reason, Hanan has applied for a loan to pay for her son’s semester fees.

Because Hanan is a conservative person, she requested that her son Ahmad take the photo instead.

loans.use: To pay for her son's semester fees.

loans.name: Nour Aldeen

texts.en:
Nour Aldeen, 21 years old, is single. He owns a shop for selling different types of trees for decoration and for farming.

The shop has been running for almost two years now and he would like to improve it by adding new types of plants and expand the store. For that reason, he has applied for a youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more plants for his store

loans.name: Buthaina

texts.en:
Buthaina, 28 years old, is a young widow. 

To be able to support herself, Buthaina opened a store for selling food products such as rice, sugar, salt, canned goods, snacks, etc. The store has been operating for the last three years.
 
Now Buthaina has applied for a youth loan in order to add more food products and improve the quality of the food products that she sells so she can attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy more food products for the store

loans.name: Odai

texts.en:
Odai, 21 years old and single, is one of an eight-member family.

Odai is college student who is studying economics at Zarqaa University. At the same time, he works at one of the fast food restaurants so he can afford his daily expenses.

Today, Odai has applied for a loan to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Heba, 18 years old, has two sisters and one brother. She is single. 

Heba is a fresh student at one of the Jordanian Universities studying biological engineering. She has applied for this loan to pay for her semester’s fees.

loans.use: To pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 38 years old, married with three children.  She sells mobile phone chargers and batteries to earn a living.  She has been in the business for 2 years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future.  She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy mobile phone chargers and batteries.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone chargers and batteries.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf, 20 years old, is single and the youngest of four brothers.

Ashraf is an accounting student studying at one of the Jordanian Universities. After graduation, he wants to work in the field whether in a private company or in the banking field.

Today Ashraf has applied for a loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, 28 years old, is a single man. He opened a store for selling mobile phones and accessories, and recently added a new section for maintenance. 

Ahmad has applied for a youth loan to start working on opening another branch in another place for selling mobile phones and accessories.

loans.use: to open another branch of his store

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is engaged in agriculture.  He keeps cattle and cultivates land. 

Gevorg has applied for this loan to expand his farm.  Gevorg plans to purchase calves.  This will allow him to receive meat and milk, not only to sustain his family, but also to sell and get additional income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To pay for calves.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 39 years old and she is the mother of one child.  She runs a cafeteria to earn a living and she has been in this business for 3 years and employew two people. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future.  She has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy maize flour, sugar and utensils.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar and utensils.

loans.name: Macharious

texts.en:
Macharious is 48 years old, married with four children.  He does tailoring to earn a living and he has been in this business for 20 years and employes two people. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to grow his business in the future.  He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ghaleb

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq.  He is 45 years old, married and has four children.

Ghaleb is an owner of a metal turning workshop since 2003.  He has sufficient experience in this field, a good reputation and a deep understanding of local consumer needs.  He is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan in order to purchase an electric generator for his workshop.  He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to purchase an electric generator for his workshop.

loans.name: Artyom

texts.en:
Artyom is a young entrepreneur from Yerevan.  He trades fruits, vegetables and juices from his shop.  Artyom lives with his mother, who helps Artyom to run the business, and pensioner father. 

Artyom has applied for this loan to purchase fruits, vegetables, juices and sweets for the shop.  He hopes to increase the sales and get more income, which he plans to invest in further expansion of the business.

loans.use: To pay for fruits, vegetables, juices and sweets.

loans.name: Mawugnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAWUGNON est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Aimée-Sophie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Aimée-Sophie est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à un gendarme du nom de Dorothé. Aimée-Sophie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés dont un reste à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Aimée-Sophie mène comme activité depuis quatre ans environs la vente des sacs de charbons de bois et des céréales dans un marché du Bénin et dans son quartier. Cette activité lui permet de contribuer sans grande difficulté aux besoins de la maison. Aimée-Sophie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Aimée-Sophie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAWUGNON, un deuxième crédit. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The MAWUGNON group is composed of three people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the second time that the group is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé, in order to raise the level of their business activity.

Aimée-Sophie, who is raising her hand in the photograph, is the group's representative. Aimée-Sophie is 44 years old and married to a policeman named Dorothé. Aimée-Sophie lives with her husband and her children. The couple has three children, one of whom remains in their care. All of their children are in school. The various household expenses are covered by the couple.

In order to cover these expenses, Aimée-Sophie has been selling bags of charcoal and cereals at a market in Benin and in her neighborhood for about four years now. This business allows her to contribute to the needs of her family without great difficulty. Aimée-Sophie gets her supplies from a market in Benin.

Striving to satisfy her customers and increase her turnover and revenues, Aimée-Sophie, along with the other members of the MAWUGNON group, is seking a second loan. The first loan was correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and bags of cereals

loans.name: Yandé

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée , mère de huit enfants dont trois vont à l'école.Elle tient une boutique alimentaire dans son village. Deux de ses fils sont des pêcheurs et disposent d'une grande pirogue artisanale .Ils vont en mer pour 15 jours et obtiennent des revenus assez importants lorsque les prises sont bonnes.L'essentiel des besoins de la famille sont satisfaits grâce à cette activité de pêche. Ainsi, pour  moderniser l' équipement de pêche, cette brave femme sollicite un pret de 250000 f pour acheter un moteur neuf pour la pirogue.Elle a déjà payé à l'UIMCEC 4 prêts sans aucun retard. Son ambition est de construire la maison familiale.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married woman and the mother of 8 children, 3 of whom attend school. She runs a food store in her village. 2 of her sons are fishermen and have a large hand-crafted canoe. They go to sea for 15 days at a time and earn a significant income when the catch is good. The family´s essential needs are taken care of thanks to this fishing activity.

In order to be able to modernise the fishing equipment, this good woman is requesting a loan of 250 000 francs with which she plans to buy a new engine for the canoe. She has already promptly repaid 4 previous UIMCEC loans. Her aim is to build a family home.

loans.use: to buy a new engine.

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis is 23 years old. He trades in bags and accessories for women. He has applied for this loan to develop his business. 

Sargis plans to purchase more bags and accessories. This will allow him to meet the clients’ demand and increase his sales. Sargis will get additional income and invest in further expansion of his business.

loans.use: to pay for bags and women's accessories.

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en:
Hakob is a 29 years old trader form Yerevan.  He trades sports clothing and shoes from a rented booth in the city market.  Hakob needs some financial investment to increase the clothing variety. 

With the help of this loan he plans to purchase sports clothing.  Hakob hopes he will increase sales and get more income.  This is important for Hakob and his family, as he will insure better future for them.  Hakob lives with his mother, two brothers and sister.

loans.use: To pay for sports clothing.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, single, and lives with five family members, two of whom work.

Mohamad has been an owner of a household store since 2010, selling kitchen supplies and gifts. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $2,100 loan in order to install a sliding door, an outdoor ceiling, and to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to install a sliding door, an outdoor ceiling, and to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a business frying potatoes for sale from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes and cooking fat.

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq.  He is 28 years old, married and has two children.

Hisham has been an owner of a shop since 2006, selling used clothing.  He has sufficient experience in this field, a good reputation and a deep understanding of local consumer needs.  He is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan in order repair and renovate his shop.  He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order repair and renovate his shop.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is a 23 year old trader.  She lives with her mother and sister.  Liana's mother is also a trader and her sister is a nurse. 

For already two years Liana trades women's gowns and shoes in the city market.  Liana would like to increase the inventory variety and sell women's blouses, too.  Thus she has applied for a loan. T his loan will help Liana to to develop her business and expand it in the future.

loans.use: To pay for clothing.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is involved in agriculture. She keeps cattle and cultivates land. 

Alina has been running her farm for ten years, and through these years she has created favorable conditions to develop it. She plans to use the requested loan to purchase young pigs and develop pig-breeding. She will also purchase seeds to cultivate the land. This will allow Alina to increase her income and ensure better living conditions for her sons.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and young pigs.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, 28, is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She dreams of establishing a boutique to sell her clothes in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq.  He is 52 years old, married and has three children who all work.

Salah has been an owner of a restaurant since 2009; he offers different types of food.  He has more than five years experience from previous work, and has a good reputation.  His restaurant is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan in order to fix and repair his restaurant’s walls and floors.  He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to fix and repair his restaurant’s walls and floors.

loans.name: Edik

texts.en: Edik is a 49-year-old entrepreneur from Kajaran. He runs a little facility where he repairs cars and provides other technical services for cars. Edik has applied for this loan to purchase tools and devices for cars. This will allow him to provide necessary services to his clients, as well as to increase the services' quality. Edik will develop his business and get more income, which will allow him to renovate his house and insure a better life for his family. Edik lives with his wife, his son who is a student, and his daughter.

loans.use: to pay for tools and devices for cars.

loans.name: Wanoude Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANOUDE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Généviève est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Généviève est âgée de 25 ans et vit au Bénin. Généviève a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Généviève est mariée à un certain Carmel. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. Généviève vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Généviève vend depuis une dizaine d’années, des sacs de charbons de bois. Dans le but d’acquérir plus de profits et d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire, Généviève désire ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANOUDE, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra certainement d’accroître leur chiffre d’affaire et par ricochet leur revenu. Le crédit obtenu précédemment a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Wanoude group is made up of 3 people who live in the same district. This is the second time that the group is requesting a loan from ALIDé in order to increase their business activity.

The group´s representative, Généviève, is the woman with her hand raised in the picture. She is 25 years old and lives in Benin. She left school during secondary level. She is married to Carmel and the couple is raising one child who goes to school. Généviève lives together with her husband and child. For the past 12 years, she has been selling charcoal in order to be able to cover the family´s various expenses.

In order to be able to increase their turnover and profits, Généviève and the other members of the Wanoude group are requesting a 2nd loan from ALIDé. This loan will certainly enable them to improve their sales and thereby their revenues. They fully repaid their previous loan.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ismaila

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ismaïlia  est un jeune marchand âgé de 26 ans qui fait du commerce depuis 2001.Il est marié et père d’un enfant.
Il possède un magasin ou il vend de l’aliment bétail et des céréales: du foin, du ripasse,de l'arachide,du mil …et le prêt va lui permettre de varier  sa marchandise.
En temps que chef de famille, Ismaila subvient aux besoins quotidiens des membres de cette dernière.
Dans l’ avenir , son plus grand vœu, serai d’acheter un cheval pour faire de l’agriculture.
texts.en:
Monsieur Ismaila is a young shopkeeper, twenty-six years old, who has been doing business since 2001. He is married and father of a child.
He has a store where he sells food for livestock and grains: hay, ground nut oil cakes, ground nuts, millet... and the loan is going to allow him to vary his merchandise. 
As head of the family, Ismaila provides for the everyday needs of the members of his family.
In the future, his biggest wish would be to buy a horse for farming.

loans.use: to buy and resell food for livestock (hay, ground nut oil cakes), grains.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Emprendedor es la mejor palabra con la que se pueda conocer a Miguel Angel, un joven de tan solo 18 años de edad que ya montó su propio negocio y el cual trabaja fuertemente con el ánimo de sacarlo adelante.
Miguel Angel desde hace un tiempo aprendió la actividad de la elaboración de calzado, gracias a que su padre le enseñó desde muy pequeño, y es por esto que Miguel Angel escogió esta actividad con el ánimo de generar sus propios ingresos, colaborarles a sus padres, y progresar económicamente.
Miguel Angel además de trabajar en su taller de elaboración de zapatos es estudiante de la universidad, la cual le ha brindado grandes conocimientos, y espera que lo prepare para que en un futuro pueda acceder a un empleo muy bien remunerado. 
Miguel Angel en su taller tiene muy buenos contratos con empresas para entregarles la producción, por lo que aspira a que en un futuro tenga muy buenos ingresos.
Con el ánimo de poder entregar a tiempo un pedido de un cliente, Miguel Angel requiere de la compra de insumos para la elaboración del calzado, como es el cuero, pegamento, suela, entre otros insumos más; sin embargo, Miguel Angel no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la compra de estos insumos, debido a que sus clientes le pagan una vez entregada toda la mercancía. Es por esto que Miguel Angel aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de los insumos para su taller como lo es el caucho, el pegamento, la suela, entre otros, y poder así seguir entregando sus pedidos a sus clientes.
Miguel Angel sueña con que su negocio sea un gran taller con una marca propia, y en el cual pueda generar mucho empleo. Además, sueña con que su negocio le brinde muy buenos ingresos de modo que sus padres no tengan que trabajar más y puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida. 
Miguel Angel se ve en un futuro como un gran empresario, muy reconocido, y el cual le pueda brindar muchas posibilidades de empleo a muchas personas con necesidad.
texts.en:
"Enterprising" is the best word for getting to know Miguel Angel, an 18-years-old who has already set up his own business and who works doggedly with a zeal for getting ahead. 

Miguel Angel learned how to make footwear some time ago, thanks to his father who taught him when he was very little. That's why Miguel Angel chose this business, with the desire to generate his own income, help out his parents, and make financial progress. 

In addition to working in his shoemaking workshop, Miguel Angel is a university student which has brought him great knowledge. He hopes that it will prepare him so that in the future he may access a very well-paid position. 

In his shop Miguel Angel has very good contracts with businesses to whom he supplies the results of his labor, and so he hopes in the future to have a very good income. 

With hopes of being able to deliver an order to a customer on time, Miguel Angel needs to purchase supplies for making footwear, such as leather, glue, and soles among other additional supplies. However Miguel Angel does not have sufficient capital to purchase these supplies, since his customers pay him only after all the merchandise has been delivered. Thus he hopes a loan will allow him the possibility of purchasing the supplies for his shop, such as rubber, glue and soles among other items, so as to continue delivering his customers their orders. 

Miguel Angel dreams of having his business be a large workshop with its own brand, and which also would generate many jobs. In addition he dreams that his business would bring him very good income so his parents wouldn't have to work anymore, and that they would have a better quality of life. 

Miguel Angel sees for himself a future as a great businessman, very well-known, and which would allow for many possibilities of employment for many persons in need.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making footwear including rubber, glue, and soles among other items.

loans.name: Ayidote Guindehougon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIDOTE GUINDEHOUGON est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Dossou-Gue A. Débora est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Dossou-Gue A. Débora est âgée de 51 ans et vit au Bénin. Dossou-Gue A. Débora n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Dossou-Gue A. Débora est mariée à un certain Dénis. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés dont un reste à leur charge. Dossou-Gue A. Débora vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant à charge. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Dossou-Gue A. Débora vend depuis huit ans, des condiments dans son quartier. Dossou-Gue A. Débora s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaires et son revenu, Dossou-Gue A. Débora sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYIDOTE GUINDEHOUGON, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The group AYIDOTE GUINDEHOUGON is made up of three people who live in the same area. This is the second time that this group is asking for the financial support of Alidé, in order to raise the level of their business activities. The representative of the group, named Dossou-Gue A. Débora, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Dossou-Gue A. Débora is fifty-one years old and lives in Benin. Dossou-Gue A. Débora did not attend school. Dossou-Gue A. Débora is married to a man named Denis. The couple has two children, both in school, and one of whom is in their care. Dossou-Gue A. Débora lives together with her husband and the child in their care. The couple provides for the various needs of the household together. In order to provide for the various needs of the family, Dossou-Gue A. Débora has been selling spices in her area for eight years. Dossou-Gue A. Débora stocks up in a market in Benin. In seeking the satisfaction of her customers and to increase her profits and revenue, Dossou-Gue A. Débora is asking, together with the other members of the AYIDOTE GUINDEHOUGON group, for a second loan from Alidé. Their first loan was correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy spices.

loans.name: Akuetin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AKUETIN est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la septième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Jeanne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Jeanne est âgée de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Jeanne a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Jeanne est mariée à un certain Lucien. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Jeanne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Jeanne exerce depuis huit ans environs, la vente des friperies par le système de distribution. De façon secondaire, Jeanne vend des fruits. Jeanne s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Jeanne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AKUETIN, un septième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les six premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The AKUETIN group is made up of three friends who live in the same neighborhood. This is the seventh time that the group is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé, in order to raise the level of its business activity.

Jeanne, whose hand is raised in the photograph, is the group's representative. Jeanne is 34 years old and lives in Benin. She stopped attending school during primary school. Jeanne is married to Lucien. The couple has three children, all of whom are in their care and attend school. Jeanne lives with her husband and children.

In order to cover the various family expenses, Jeanne has been selling secondhand clothing by the distribution system for about eight years now. On the side, Jeanne sells fruit. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin.

In order to satisfy her customers and increase her turnover and revenue, Jeanne, along with the other members of the AKUETIN group, is seeking a seventh loan from ALIDé. The first six loans were all correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes and fruit.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with three children, all of whom are grown-ups. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past seven years, she has operated a cereals selling business, selling at the market to her town dwellers and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Janet dreams of establishing more shops to sell in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of rice for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice for resale.

loans.name: Hasmiik

texts.en: Hasmiik lives in Sisian with her husband and parents-in-law. The family gets its main income from farming. Hasmiik cultivates corn, potatoes and beans. Hasmiik would like to get involved in cattle breeding, too. Thus she has applied for a loan to purchase a cow. Besides, with the loan's help Hasmiik plans to purchase seeds to cultivate the land and fuel. This loan will help Hasmiik to develop her farm and expand it further in the future.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, seeds and fuel.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his place of operation. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase bales of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice for sale.

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Christy has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for  two years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Christy has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  In the future, Christy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa is a 33-year-old married woman. She has three sons, her husband has two jobs so he can support the family. 

To help her husband, Asmaa built an outside room and turned it into a small shop for selling accessories and toys. The shop is located on the way to a school, so a lot of children and teenagers come to buy from her. 

Now Asmaa has applied for a loan to expand and add a new line of products, specifically home products, to her store.

loans.use: to add a new line of home products to her store.

loans.name: Fatimata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatimata est une dame de 51 ans qui s’active dans le commerce de pagnes tissé et d'ustensiles de cuisine:plats,bols depuis plus de 32 ans .Elle est marié et mère  de  trois enfants. Madame Fatimata  fait parti des premières clientes de la caisse  ou elle a  bénéficié de plusieurs prêts pour améliorer son commerce qui consiste à marchander avec un tisserand pour la confection de pagnes tissés qu’elle va ensuite mettre sur le marché. Elle va donc acheter du fil et payer la main d’œuvre.Avec le crédit, elle va aussi acheter des plats et des bols pour le revendre dans le quartier.
Madame Fatimata  désire avoir une assise et une autonomie financière dans son activité pour pouvoir construire convenablement sa maison.
texts.en:
Madame Fatimata is a fifty-one year old woman who has been active in the sales of woven pagnes (colorful wax cloth) and kitchen utensils: casseroles dishes and bowls, for more than thirty-two years. Madame Fatimata was one of the first clients at this branch office, where she has benefited from several loans to improve her business, which consists of haggling with a weaver for the making of woven pagnes that she will then put up for sale. She is therefore going to buy thread and pay for labor. With the loan, she is also going to buy casserole dishes and bowls that she will resell in the area.
Madame Fatimata wants to have a foundation and financial autonomy in her business in order to be able to build her house properly.

loans.use: to buy thread to make woven pagne, and bowls and casserole dishes to resell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Lilia has a shop that sells bananas & coconuts. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy bananas & coconuts to sell.

Lilia has been a member of HSPFI since 2007.  In the future, Lilia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas & coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Milagros has a shop selling bananas & coconuts. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy bananas & coconuts to sell.

Milagros has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Milagros  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas & coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 36-year-old married woman. She has two sons and two daughters. 

Mona started a small home-based business to help in supporting the family and have another income beside her husband's business. She started collecting and buying used clothes for sale. 

Mona hopes that she and her husband can move from selling on the roadsides to having a shop for selling used clothes, so as a start she has applied for a loan to buy more clothes and later open their own store.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes and later open her own store.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Maricel has a retail shop  with canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Maricel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Maricel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Nonvignon 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGNON 2 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Antoinette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Antoinette est âgée de 52 ans et vit au Bénin. Antoinette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Antoinette est une veuve et est mère de trois enfants. Antoinette subvient seule aux divers besoins de la maison. Pour faire face aux diverses charges, Antoinette vend depuis dix sept ans, des sacs de maïs par le système de distribution. Antoinette s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaires et son revenu, Antoinette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON 2, un septième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Nonvignon 2 is composed of three persons living in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative, by the name of Antoinette, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Antoinette is 52 years old and lives in Benin. Antoinette never attended school. Antoinette is a widow and the mother of three. Antoinette provides for the various needs of her household on her own. In order to support herself, for the last seven years Antoinette has been selling bags of corn using a distribution system. Antoinette stocks up at a market in Benin. With the goal of meeting customer demand and increasing her sales volume and her revenues, Antoinette, together with the other members of the Nonvignon 2 group, is seeking a seventh loan from ALIDé. The prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Elizabeth has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has also food shop or "carenderia" selling viands. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks & raw ingredients needed for making viands.

Elizabeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & raw ingredients needed for making viands.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Claire has a shop selling snacks like rice cakes, pan cakes & sweetened rice or "suman". She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making snacks to sell.

Claire has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Claire hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks to sell.

loans.name: Lina Maria

texts.es:
Lina Maria ha sido una persona que ha sufrido muchas adversidades en su vida. Sin embargo, esto no le ha impedido salir adelante, gracias a que trabaja fuertemente todos los días, y siempre tiene un espíritu de superación constante.
Lina Maria es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 3 hijos, ya que el padre de los hijos la abandonó sin proporcionarle ninguna ayuda económica.
Es por esto que Lina Maria al verse en la obligación de generar los ingresos para su hogar, empezó a trabajar fuertemente vendiendo mercancía, actividad que desarrolló durante mucho tiempo, debido que aunque sabía confeccionar, no tenía a quién ofrecerle este servicio.
Actualmente Lina Maria ya tiene un contrato con un almacén de calzado, y ella le confecciona sus productos. Debido a esto, Lina Maria pueda generar los ingresos suficientes para suplir las necesidades básicas de su familia, para poderles brindar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
Gracias a que tiene un muy buen contrato con el almacén de calzado, Lina Maria requiere contratar a una persona para que le ayude en la confección del calzado, por lo que también requiere de la compra de una máquina para confeccionar los productos. Sin embargo, Lina Maria no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la compra de la máquina, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una máquina de coser, que le permita trabajar a la persona que contratará para que le ayude en los trabajos que debe realizar a su cliente.
Lina Maria sueña que su taller siga creciendo, que sus contratos sigan incrementándose, para poder seguir generando empleos como este. 
Además, sueña con que sus hijos puedan acceder a una educación universitaria de calidad, que les permita prepararse para conseguir un buen empleo bien remunerado.
texts.en:
