Vicheka is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase construction materials to build her house. By doing so, her family will have better living conditions. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store to generate more income for the family and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build her house.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with six children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a farming business, selling farm produce of beans and peas from door to door to her neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Nyamvula dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase seeds for farming. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for farming.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is a married woman with six children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Habiba operates a car wash business from home where motor vehicle operators are her potential customers. In addition she also operates a meat-goat selling business from which she earns her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of water shortage for her car wash business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase more goats for resale and a water tank for water storage for the car wash business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase more goats for resale and a water tank for water storage for a car wash business.

loans.name: Juan Felipe

texts.es:
Juan Felipe es una persona muy dedicada a su familia, a quienes siempre les ha querido brindar todo lo que necesitan.
Juan Felipe, con 23 años de edad, ya ha conformado una familia con su pareja y un hijo de 1 año de edad, quien siempre es la motivación para trabajar arduamente durante todos los días. Juan Felipe siempre ha querido que su familia no tenga que pasar por dificultades económicas, y es por esto que siempre que tiene la oportunidad genera nuevas fuentes de ingresos diferentes a su actividad principal.
Juan Felipe se dedica desde hace aproximadamente 3 años a la venta de frutas en la plaza mayorista de su municipio, y gracias a este trabajo genera los ingresos suficientes para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
Juan Felipe ha tenido muy buena clientela gracias a sus productos de buena calidad y al buen servicio que ofrece, sin embargo, su negocio ha visto como se ha deteriorado con el paso de los años. Juan Felipe entonces quiere realizarle algunas mejoras a su negocio, además de surtir su negocio con más productos, pero no tiene el capital suficiente para ello. Es por esto que Juan Felipe aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de frutas como papaya principalmente, y a realizarle mejoras locativas a su sitio de venta.

Juan Felipe tiene el sueño de que su negocio le pueda dar buenos ingresos, y le permita brindarles a su hijo y su esposa una mejor calidad de vida.
Además, sueña con que su hijo pueda acceder a una educación de calidad, y tenga la oportunidad de en un futuro ingresar a una educación universitaria que le permita acceder a un empleo bien remunerado.
texts.en:
Juan Felipe is very dedicated to his family. He has always loved providing them with their every need.
At the age of 23, Juan Felipe already has a family: he and his wife have a one-year-old baby. They are always his motivation for working hard every day. Juan Felipe has always wanted to shield his family from economic hardship. For this reason, whenever he has the chance he generates new sources of income on top of his main job.
Juan Felipe has sold fruit for approximately three years in the wholesale market of his municipality. Thanks to this work, he makes enough money to support his family.
Juan Felipe has a very good customer base thanks to the good quality of his products and his excellent customer service. However, his business has deteriorated with the passing of time. Therefore, Juan Felipe wants to make some improvements to his business as well as to stock his business with more products; but he does not have the necessary capital for this project. For this reason, Juan Felipe hopes to get a loan which will allow him to buy fruit such as papaya, mainly, and to make some improvements to his stand.
Juan Felipe dreams of his business providing him with a good income, and allowing him to offer his wife and child a better quality of life. He dreams of his child being able to access a good, quality education, and to have the opportunity to attend university and find a well-paid job.

loans.use: to buy stock; fruit, mainly papaya, and to make some improvements to his stand.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is twenty-four years old. He runs a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years and employs one person. He describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a loan of KES 15,000 to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a married man with three children, one of whom attends school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 12 years, he has operated a carpentery business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. In addition he also operates a "boda boda" (motorcycle) transportation business. He faces a major challenge of lack of customers to buy his products. He dreams of expanding the business and establishing a workshop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase timber for use in the carpentry business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase timber for use in the carpentry business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 22 years old, married with two children. She sells clothes to earn a living, and she has been in the business for four years and has employed one person. She does farming to earn extra income. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy blouses and sweaters to sell.

loans.use: To buy blouses and sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno, 36, is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a cereals business, selling millet, sorghum, maize and beans from door to door and also from home. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation while moving from door to door. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) she wants to purchase sacks of millet, sorghum, beans and maize for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of millet, sorghum, beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She sells clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. She does farming to earn extra income. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy trousers and skirts for resale.

loans.use: To buy trousers and skirts for resale

loans.name: Kuany

texts.en:
Kuany is 32 years old and a married woman with four children; two of them are in school. She has had a food stall in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Kuany is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Blanca Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Blanca tiene 30 años de edad, esta acompaña con dos hijos.

Hace 6 años que se dedica al comercio, es propietaria de una tienda, ella aprendió esté negocio con su suegra, quien también tiene una pequeña tienda. Antes de instalar su propia tienda Blanca no tenia ninguna fuente de ingresos y debido a la necesidad de brindarle alimentación a sus hijos, empezó a vender productos de la canasta básica y fue viendo que los resultados eran positivos fue creciendo su negocio y sus ingresos. Ella adquiere todo lo que necesita para la tienda en el mercado de la ciudad, por lo que debe caminar a pie hasta la carretera para abordar el autobús, los otros productos se los van a dejar los camiones repartidores a su casa.  

Blanca solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar dos quintales de frijoles, cinco quintales de maíz, tres cajas de jabón, detergentes, aceite comestible, bebidas, útiles escolares y el resto del dinero los invertirá en productos varios. De esta manera ella surtirá su tienda y se asegurara de tener de todo un poco, para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y evitar que ellos compren en otro lugar. 

Al mantener más surtida su tienda, venderá más y así sus ingresos serán mayores para cancelar su préstamo, asegurar la alimentación de su familia y brindarles el estudio a sus hijos para que estudien una carrera académica.
texts.en:
Señora Blanca is 30 and has two children.
She has been a merchant for six years and owns her own store. She learned this business from her mother-in-law, who also has a small store. Before opening her store, Blanca did not have a source of income; due to the need to provide for her children, she started to sell basic goods. The results were good, and her business and income have grown. She buys everything that she needs for the store in the city market; in order to do so, she has to walk to the highway to catch the bus. Other products are delivered to her home.
Blanca is requesting this loan from Fundacion Campo for the purchase of two quintals of beans, five quintals of corn, three boxes of soap, detergent, oil, drinks, school supplies, and other varied merchandise. This way, she will stock her store and make sure that she has a bit of everything in order to satisfy customer demand and ensure that her customers don't go elsewhere to make their purchases.
By maintaining her store well-stocked, she will sell more and increase her income so that she can pay off her loan. She will be able to ensure that she can support her family and provide her children with an education so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy two quintals of beans, five quintals of corn, three boxes of soap, detergent, oil, drinks, school supplies, and other varied products.

loans.name: Sinoeurn

texts.en: Sinoeurn, thirty-six, is married, and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been growing vegetables and flowers to sell for over ten years and is successful in her career. She earns approximately USD 2.7 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and earns approximately USD 3 per day. Her two children are employed; one is a garment worker and another one is a automobile mechanic. Due to the lack of funds for building her house, Sinoeurn is asking for a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase construction materials to construct the house. In the future, she would like to expand her business by growing more vegetables to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build her house.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is 37 years old. She is a mother of one child. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for seven years and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to own a wholesale in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nyantet

texts.en:
Nyantet is a 28-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food items in Bor, South Sudan for two years. 

Nyantet is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil for resale.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi 49, is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past seven years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing vegetables. She dreams of establishing a shop to sell her vegetables in. 

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables and fruit for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables and fruit for resale.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Ruby has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Ruby has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Ruby hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim, 31 years old, is married and has two children, ages three and seven years. He describes himself as a go-getter and an ambitious man. He has been selling cereals for the last three years to local residents. In addition, he also sells herbal medicine. His business challenge is inadequate funds to improve the retail cereal shop. He will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more cereals such as maize, beans, etc. Salim's hope and dream in the future is to have diversified his business and venture into a grocery store to increase his income.

loans.use: to  buy more cereals such as maize, beans, etc.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 14 children. 

Mila has a shop that sells bananas, sweet potatoes & cassava per kilogram. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 6,000 PHP to buy bananas, sweet potatoes & cassava to sell.

Mila has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Mila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, sweet potatos & cassava to sell.

loans.name: Fatou Ndiaye

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou Ndiaye, âgée de 44 ans est commerçante depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille.
Avec le crédit qu’elle sollicite elle voudrait aller à Rosso en Mauritanie pour  acheter des produits cosmétiques, des chaussures et des tissus pour venir le revendre dans le pays.
Madame Fatou Ndiaye aide son époux dans la gérance des dépenses  du foyer  en payant la scolarité des  enfants.
Elle aimerait avoir une bonne assise et agrandir son activité dans le futur.
texts.en:
Fatou Ndiaye is 44 years old and has been a shopkeeper for over 10 years. She is married and a mother. She would like to use the money from the loan she is requesting to go to Rosso, in Mauritania, in order to buy beauty products, shoes and fabrics to resell back in her country.

Fatou Ndiaye supports her husband with the household expenditures by paying for the children´s education. She would like to establish a good foundation and to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, shoes and fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Lidio Edvín

texts.es:
Lidio tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su mamá, una hermana y tres sobrinos. Desde hace dos años labora como vigilante en una empresa y se considera una persona muy capaz para desempeñarlo. Antes se dedicaba a realizar actividades agrícolas que fue lo que su papá le enseño.

Siempre realiza cultivos pero solo son para consumo de su familia, los insumos como abono, pesticidas los compra en una ciudad del oriente del país y para llegar ahí debe caminar dos kilómetros y medio, hasta abordar el autobús. De regreso debe cargar los insumos y caminar con ellos hasta su casa.

Lidio solicita el préstamo para comprar cemento, arena, hierro, pago de mano de obra, para construir un corredor a la casa ya que el que tiene esta dañado. De esta manera su familia estará más segura ya que la condición en la que se encuentra el corredor es peligrosa, por que debido a los temblores se daño la viga que soporta el peso y en  este momento Lidio no tiene el dinero para repararlo. Mas adelante desea realizar otros arreglos en la vivienda como ponerle el piso, entre otros más. Y proporcionar a su familia una vivienda digna y segura.
texts.en:
Lidio is 29, single, and lives with his mother, sister, and three nieces and nephews. He has worked as a security guard for a business for two years, and he is very good at his job. Before getting this job, he worked in agriculture; this is the job his father taught him.
He still cultivates food, but only for his family's consumption. He buys supplies such as fertilizer and pesticides in a city in the east of the country. In order to get there, he has to walk two and a half kilometers to catch the bus. Coming back, he has to carry everything with him and walk back home.
Lidio is requesting this loan for the purchase of cement, sand, and iron, and to pay labourers to build a hallway in his home; the current one is damaged. This way, his family will be more secure; the hallway is dangerous. The earthquakes have damaged the supporting beam, and Lidio doesn't have the money to repair it. In the future he wants to make other repairs to his home; for example, to put in a floor. He wants to provide his family with a dignified and secure home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, and to pay labourers to build a hallway in his home.

loans.name: Bara

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune célibataire qui vit avec ses deux parents et ses frères et sœurs. Il exerce l'activité d'élevage notamment l'embouche bovine. Il achète des bœufs qu'il engraisse avant de les vendre sur le marché local.Il génère des revenus consistants qui lui permettent de prendre en charge ses propres besoins et de participer largement aux dépenses d'entretien de la famille. Afin de renforcer son activité, il sollicite un prêt de 300 000f pour acheter 2 bœufs.Son ambition est de construire un étable moderne.
texts.en:
The borrower is a young, single man who lives with his two parents and his brothers and sisters.

He raises animals, focusing, in particular, on cow fattening . He buys cows, fattens them, and then sells them at the local market. He generates a consistent revenue, which allows him to take care of his own needs and to contribute in a big way to the family's expenses.

In order to strengthen his business, he is seeking a loan of 300,000f to buy two cows. His goal is to build a modern stable.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows

loans.name: Kambeng Bloc 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kambeng Bloc  1  est créé depuis  l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la culture. 

Madame  Yama, (debout à l’extrême  droite), est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans, est mariée  et mère de 05 enfants, elle prend en charge deux autres élèves qui sont des proches parents venant des villages environnant. Elle cultive de l’arachide qu’elle transforme en patte pour la revente.

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en semence pour mieux préparer la culture durant la saison des pluies.

Les  bénéfices, elle compte appuyer son mari dans la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The Kambeng Bloc 1 group has been created at the inauguration of the  “banc villageois.” It is composed of 15 women living in the same area. They work as vendors and farmers.

Mrs. Yama (standing on the far right) is the group’s leader. She is 48 years, married and the mother of five. She also takes care of two other school-aged children, relatives from nearby villages. She grows peanuts and prepares peanut paste for sale. With this loan she plans to stock up on seeds in order to better prepare for farming during the rainy season. She plans to use the revenues to help her husband provide for the children’s schooling.

loans.use: to stock up on seeds in order to better prepare for farming during the rainy season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty products and bedsheets for resale.

loans.name: Alba Azucena

texts.es: Alba, de 27 años de edad ella se dedica a la costureria ella elavora prendas de vestir como faldas,vestidos bordados,escotes,etc aparte de eso ella tiene aotra actividad que es la crinza de pollos,ella nos cuenta que que es una gran oportunidad para ella ya que nececita de capital para agrandar mas su negocio,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de rollos de leta de sincatex,hilo,aujas,botones,conos de todos colores,y asi de esa manera seguir con su negocio,
texts.en: Alba, who is 27 years old, works as a seamstress. She makes articles of clothing such as skirts, embroidered dresses, sleeveless blouses, etc. Besides this, she has another activity, which is raising chickens. She tells us that this is a great opportunity for her since she needs the capital to enlarge her business. She is applying for this loan to buy bolts of Sincatex (brand) fabric, thread, needles, buttons, and cones of thread in all colors, and in this way to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy sewing items such as Sincatex (brand) fabrics, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Nelly Edwige

texts.fr:
Cliente de 29 ans, mariée et mère d'un enfant, elle est vendeuse des sandales des dames depuis bientôt 12 ans, ayant deja bénéficie d'un cycle de prêts .
 elle est a l'heure actuelle parmi les grandes fournisseuses de chaussures dans le marche, elle fait la vente en gros et en détail, ses ventes ont entièrement augmentées, elle a épargne énormément et a améliorer les conditions de vie de son foyer.
Pour le second prêt, elle va renforcer la capacité de stock de ses sandales pour hommes, dames et enfants.
Tres gentille, elle a pour ambition d'être grossiste et a la longue ouvrir un salon de coiffure pour l'élargissement de ses activités
texts.en:
The client is 29 years old, married and the mother of one child. She has been selling women's sandals for nearly 12 years and has already benefited from one loan cycle.

She is currently one of the large suppliers of shoes at the market and she sells either wholesale or retail. Her sales have increased markedly and she has been able to save a lot of money and improve the living conditions of her household.

She will use the second loan to restock on sandals for men, women and children. A kind lady, her ambition is to become a wholesaler and, eventually, expand her business activities and open a hair salon.

loans.use: to restock on sandals for men, women and children.

loans.name: Ambrose

texts.en:
Ambrose, thirty-eight, is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past seven years, he has operated a retail shop business which he sells household goods like maize flour and wheat flour. In addition he also operates a motorcycle transport business from which he earns his other source of income. 

With the KES 30,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and beans for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his businesses.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and beans for resale.

loans.name: Diorenda

texts.en:
Diorenda is forty-one years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with nine children. 

Diorenda has a shop that sells fish like trout, sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy fish to sell.

Diorenda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Diorenda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is fifty three years old. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. She does farming to earn extra income. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to be save income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a sack of sugar and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy a sack of sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 10 children. 

Margarita has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 6,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Margarita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  

In the future, Margarita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale

loans.name: Bernaflor

texts.en:
Bernaflor is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Bernaflor has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Bernaflor has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  

In the future,Bernaflor hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Francois Herve

texts.fr:
Client de 36 ans; celibataire et  père d'un enfant age de 11 ans, il se lance dans la vente des cartes de recharges et des appels telephoniques apres son bac en 2007.
Il a deja bénéficié d'un prêt qui lui a permit d'agrandir son commerce, ses benefices ont largement augmentes et sa capacité d'achat a connu un impact considérable, il a épargné sans difficultés et s'occupe valablement de la scolarité de son fils.
Avec le second prêt, il va continuer dans le meme sens, renforcer le stock des cartes , s'abonner sur une autre ligne nationale il pense aussi a établir un abonnement internet pour satisfaire les désirs de ses clients en achetant  un ordinateur avec Modem.
A la l'avenir , il continue a faire des épargnes pour atteindre son objectif et en meme temps être grossiste.
texts.en:
This borrower is 36 years old, single, and the father of one 11-year-old child. He started selling phone cards and calls after getting his high school diploma in 2007.

He already benefited from one loan, which enabled him to expand his business. His profits increased greatly, and made a big impact on his buying capacity. He managed to put money away effortlessly, and he takes good care of his son's schooling expenses.

With this second loan, he will continue in the same direction, bolster his stock of cards, and get a subscription plan with another national operator. He's also thinking about getting an Internet connexion and computers with modems, in order to satisfy the desires of his customers.

In the future, he wants to increase his savings to reach his goal of becoming a wholesaler in addition to his current business.

loans.use: to buy various pre-paid phone cards (Airtel, MTN, Azur, and Warid)

loans.name: Rostere

texts.en:
Rostere is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 6 children. 

Rostere has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Rostere has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  

In the future, Rostere hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Concordia has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Concordia has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  

In the future, Concordia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 40-year-old married woman with 6 children, 4 of them are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for 2 years. Mary is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale

loans.name: Dau

texts.en: Dau is a 32-year-old married woman with 4 children, 3 of them are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for 3 years. Dau is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Nyibol

texts.en: Nyibol is a 30-year-old married woman with 2 children, both of them are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for 2 years. Nyibol is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has nine children. 

Marilou has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy bananas to sell.

Marilou has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marilou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Bendia Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Bendia sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 45 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la  commune rurale de Sakoïba, région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de grains d’arachide, de mortiers et de calebasses gravés. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 12ème prêt solidaire.
 Madame SAFIATOU, 2ème femme de la droite vers la gauche est la vendeuse de grains d’arachide du groupe. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 300kg de grains d’arachide. Elle se ravitaille à la foire de Boussin et parfois au marché Médine de Ségou et effectue ses ventes au comptant et à crédit, à domicile,  au grand marché de Ségou, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Madame SAFIATOU espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins du foyer au quotidien. Tout comme les autres femmes du groupe, Madame SAFIATOU a pour objectif de pérenniser son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four members of Bendia Group are married women. Most of them live in polygamous families. They average 45 years of age and four children. They all live in Sakoïba, a rural commune in Ségou Region (Fourth Administrative Region of Mali). They got acquainted through bonds of neighborhood, kinship, and marriage.

The members of the group retail peanuts, mortars, and engraved calabashes. In order to increase their working capital, they joined Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their twelfth solidarity loan (group loan).

Mrs. Safiatou, second woman on the left in the photograph, is the group's peanuts reseller. She intends to use her part of the loan to buy 300 kg of peanuts. She gets her supplies at the fair in Boussin, and sometimes also at the Médine market in Ségou.

She resells at her home and at the Grand Market in Ségou, for cash and on credit, to a clientele comprising both women and men. With this loan, she hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 35'000 (ca US$ 70), to be used to cover the daily expenses of her household, and be reinvested in her business.

Mrs. Safiatou's and the other women of the group share the same goal: ensure the future of their business through this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy 300 kg of peanuts

loans.name: Bold

texts.en: Mr. Bold, 30, is a taxi driver in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been driving for a year and already has had many customers. He lives with his wife and his son in the suburban district of the city. His family has been living in this house for many years. However, it is very old and needs to be renovated urgently. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary building materials to make renovations to his old house. He hopes it will influence his family’s living condition well.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary building materials to make renovations to his old house.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela ha sido una persona que ha tenido que atravesar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo, el gran carisma que tiene y las ganas de salir adelante, han hecho que sus problemas no le hagan ningún tropiezo en su camino que le impidan superar estas adversidades. Con 59 años de edad, Graciela es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 2 hijos a los que siempre les ha querido brindar una educación universitaria, sin embargo, los bajos ingresos no se lo han permitido. Debido a que ella es la que debe generar los ingresos para su hogar, ha trabajado muy fuertemente en diferentes actividades, pero en el momento se encuentra desempleada debido a las pocas oportunidades que se le presentan en la vida.

Graciela, con el ánimo de generar los ingresos que necesita para sostener los gastos del hogar, quiere montar una tienda general en su propia casa, donde pueda vender productos de la canasta familiar, estar pendiente del negocio y de su hogar y sus hijos al mismo tiempo. Graciela tiene un kiosco en el cual desea montar su tienda pero requiere de algunas adecuaciones, sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con dinero suficiente para surtir la tienda y adecuar el kiosco. Es por esto que Graciela tiene la esperanza de que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar y a realizarle adecuaciones locativas a su kiosco, de modo que pueda iniciar su tienda general para poder generar los ingresos que necesita.

Graciela sueña que con su negocio en marcha, pueda generar los ingresos suficientes para sostener los gastos del hogar y poder brindarles a sus hijos unas condiciones de vida dignas. 
Además, Graciela sueña que con los ingresos que le genere la tienda, pueda ofrecerles a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Graciela has been a person who has had to get through many adversities in her life. Nevertheless, her great charisma and her will to advance have meant that her problems have not put any stumbling blocks in her path that would keep her from overcoming these adversities. At the age of 59, Graciela is a single mother, the head of a family of two children to whom she has always wanted to offer a university education. Nevertheless, her low income has not allowed this. Because she is the one who has to generate the income for her household, she has worked very hard at a variety of activities, but at the moment she is unemployed thanks to the few opportunities that have been offered to her in life.

Graciela, with the will to generate the income that she needs to support the household expenses, wants to set up a general store in her own house, where she can sell basic goods and tend to her business, her home, and her children at the same time. Graciela has a kiosk where she wants to set up her store, but it needs some remodeling. Nevertheless, she does not have enough money now to stock the store and remodel the kiosk. This is why Graciela hopes that a loan will offer her the opportunity to be able to purchase basic goods to stock the store and to remodel the kiosk, so that she can open her general store and be able to generate the income that she needs.

Graciela dreams that with her business underway, she can generate sufficient income to support her household expenses and to offer her children dignified living conditions.  In addition, Graciela dreams that with the income that her store will generate, she will be able to offer her children the opportunity to study at a university.

loans.use: to buy basic food products and do some remodeling at her kiosk to set up a general store.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has four children. 

Chona has a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy a stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Chona has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Chona hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children. 

Elvira has a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy a stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Elvira has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man who has two children, both of whom attend school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, Joseph has operated a clothes-selling business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing clothes for resale. He dreams of establishing a stall to sell clothes at in the future.

With the KES 20,000, he wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Mr. Erdenebat, 43, is a taxi driver in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been driving for a year and already has had many customers. He lives with his wife and his 4 children in a common apartment. 

Last autumn, Mr. Erdenebat started his second business as a shoe retailer in the supermarket. On average, he sells 3 or 4 pairs of shoes in a day. He believes it will be a main part of his family income. Now he needs some money to purchase the large numbers of shoes from his supplier to increase his working capital. Then he could raise his sales volume after a month according to his business plan.

loans.use: to purchase the large numbers of shoes from his supplier to increase his working capital

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
El señor Rigoberto tiene 42 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos de 21, 15 y 8 años de edad respectivamente. Tiene 7 años de dedicarse al comercio en su tienda de productos básicos. A él siempre le ha gustado tener su negocio y lo de instalar su propia tienda surgió de él mismo desde que le regalaron una casa en una colonia y al ver la necesidad decidió iniciar con la tienda para obtener una fuente de ingresos para su familia y le esta siendo rentable. 

Cada ocho días Rigoberto tiene que viajar para comprar los productos para su tienda y lo hace en compañía de su esposa. El viaje es de cuarenta minutos en autobús hasta la ciudad que es el lugar donde realiza las compras.

Él solicita un préstamo para comprar más mercadería para su tienda y brindar más productos a sus clientes. Para tener siempre lo que buscan los clientes y así generar más ingresos para su familia, ya que él desea brindarles el estudio a sus hijos para que ellos se preparen académicamente y que su negocio siga creciendo aún más.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 42 years old, and lives with his life partner and their three children of 21, 15, and 8 years of age respectively. He has spent 7 years working in business in his store that sells basic products. He has always liked having his business, and having his own store came about when he was given a house on a hill and he saw the necessity of opening a store to obtain a stream of income for his family. It has been profitable. 

Every 8 days Rigoberto has to travel to buy the products for his store, and he does so in the company of his wife. The trip is 40 minutes by bus to the city where he is able to make his purchases. 

Rigoberto is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise for his store and offer more products to his clients. In order to always have what his clients are looking for and thereby generate more income for his family, he is hoping that he can provide his children with opportunities to study so they can be prepared academically and so that his business continues to grow even more.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for his store and offer more products to his clients

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en: Mrs. Tungalag, 36, is a hairdresser. She has been doing her business for 10 years and has permanent customers. She lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Tungalag wants to renovate her work tools, such as hair machine and other equipment of her barbershop, because they are becoming old and have some damage to them lately. Therefore, Tungalag is taking a loan to purchase the new hair equipment to renew her work tools.

loans.use: to purchase the new hair equipment to renew her work tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his motorcycle so he can continue transporting passengers and cargo, and to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Damaris Aide

texts.es:
Damaris se ha caracterizado por ser trabajadora y pujante para sacar a su hijo adelante. Con 39 años de edad, es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de un hijo de 6 años, al cual busca brindarle todo lo que necesita. Damaris se dedica desde hace aproximadamente 9 años a la venta de productos de uso personal, gracias a que su abuela le enseño muy bien. Damaris cuenta actualmente con muy buenos clientes, y gracias a esto puede sostener los gastos de su hogar y brindarle a su hijo una educación y una vida estable.

Damaris ha incrementado sus ventas gracias a la calidad de sus productos, a tal punto en el que ha tenido que renunciar a la venta de algunos pedidos debido a que no tiene la capacidad para responder el pedido. Damaris cuenta con muy bajo capital para comprar los pedidos por lo que debe dejar de vender a grandes cantidades. Debido a que actualmente tiene un gran pedido de un cliente que no quiere pasar por alto, Damaris tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de uso personal como son lociones, maquillaje, cremas, entre otros, y poder así cumplir con el pedido a su cliente y seguir generando más ingresos para su hogar.

Damaris sueña con no tener que vender por pocas cantidades, sino hacerse a un gran capital que le permita tener una gran distribuidora, y contratar a muchas personas que requieran de unos ingresos. Además, Damaris sueña con que su hijo pueda salir adelante, tenga una buena educación y en un futuro pueda tener acceso a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Damaris has been characterized as being hard working and forceful in order to get her son ahead. At 39 years old, she is a single mother, head of her  family with a 6 year old son, who she is looking to provide with everything he needs. Damaris has worked for approximately 9 years selling personal care products, thanks to her grandmother who taught her well. Damaris currently has very good clients, and thanks to this she can affort the expenses of her home and can offer her son an education and stable life.

Damaris has increased her sales thanks to the quality of her products, to the extent that she has had to pass up sales from some orders as a result of not having the capacity to respond to the request. Damaris has very low capital to buy the orders, which she would like to be able to sell in large quantities. Given that she currently has a large order from a client that she does not want to pass up, Damaris hopes that this loan will provide her the opportunity to make the purchase of personal care products such as lotions, makeup, and creams among others, and she can thereby complete her client's order and generate more income for her home. 

Damaris dreams of not having to sell in small quantities, rather she would like to get access to more capital that would allow her to have a larger distributor and hire many people who require income. Additionally, Damaris dreams that her son can get ahead, have a good education, and in the future have access to a university education

loans.use: to buy personal care products such as lotions, makeup, and creams among others

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
Maria Consuelo desde hace un tiempo decidió colaborar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Es por esto que decidió montar un negocio de venta de productos de catálogo como son lociones, cremas, shampoo, entre otros. Los vende a domicilio a sus familiares y vecinos y también los exhibe en una vitrina de la tienda que tiene su esposo. Maria Consuelo tiene 2 hijos de 16 y 10 años, los cuales generan muchos gastos para su hogar, y su esposo tiene unos ingresos muy bajos, es por esto que tomó la decisión de iniciar su propio negocio.

Maria Consuelo actualmente trabaja en su negocio el cual le genera una fuente de ingresos para su familia, pues tiene muy buenas ventas gracias a que sus clientes han ido creciendo poco a poco. Maria Consuelo tiene un gran pedido por parte de uno de sus clientes, por lo que tiene que comprar la mercancía a sus proveedores, sin embargo, Maria Consuelo no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar la compra de esta mercancía. Es por esto que Maria Consuelo aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de uso personal, como son lociones, cremas, shampoo, entre otros, y poder así hacer entrega del pedido que le ha hecho su cliente.

Maria Consuelo sueña que con los ingresos que le genera su negocio, su familia pueda obtener una mejor calidad de vida y sus hijos puedan acceder a una educación de calidad. Además, sueña con que en un futuro sus hijos tengan acceso a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Mario Consuelo, some time ago, decided to help her husband with the household expenses.  That is why she decided to start a business selling catalog products such as lotions, creams, shampoo, among other things.  She sells them door-to-door to family and neighbors and she also puts them on display at her husband's store.  She has two children of 16 and 10 years of age.  They create a lot of expense for her household and her husband has very low income.  This is why she decided to start her own business.

Currently she works in her business which generates income for her family since she has good sales thanks to the fact that her customer base has been growing little by little.  She has a large order on the part of one of her customers, for which she has to buy the merchandise from her suppliers, however, she does not have sufficient capital to buy the merchandise.  This is why she is requesting a loan to be able to buy these personal care items such as lotions, creams, shampoo, among others, and in this way be able to fill the large order of her customer.

Her dream is that with the income from her business, her family can achieve a better quality of life and her children can obtain a good education.  In addition, she dreams that in the future her children will have access to a university education.

loans.use: to buy personal care products such as lotion, cream, shampoo, among other things.

loans.name: Esteban Alejandro

texts.es:
Esteban es una persona muy decidida y emprendedora, que a pesar de su corta edad ya ha pasado por muchas adversidades en su vida, y gracias a su empuje y ganas de salir adelante ha podido superar. Esteban con 20 años de edad, es hijo de dos padres separados, por lo que vive con su madre y como es el mayor de sus hermanos es quien debe velar por los ingresos de su hogar. El padre de Esteban le enseñó a elaborar bandas para los billares y gracias a esto, Esteban montó su propio negocio cuando tuvo que buscar los ingresos para su hogar.

Actualmente Esteban tiene un taller que a pesar de no ser lujoso y no tener máquinas de alta tecnología, le permite generar los ingresos suficientes para mantener una calidad de vida digna a su familia. Esteban tiene muy buenos clientes, y uno de ellos le ha hecho un gran pedido, por lo que debe comprar la materia prima para fabricarlo. Sin embargo, Esteban no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar estas compras, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de materias primas para la fabricación de bandas de billar y cumplir con el pedido que le ha hecho su cliente.

Esteban sueña con que su negocio crezca y pueda modernizar sus máquinas, además de poder generar empleo y brindarle a sus hermanos y su madre una buena calidad de vida y una prosperidad económica.
texts.en:
Esteban is a very dedicated and entrepreneurial person, who despite his young age has suffered many adversities in his life, which thanks to his drive and desire to get ahead he has been able to overcome. Esteban is 20 years old, is the son of separated parents, he lives with his mother, and as the eldest of his siblings is the one who must ensure income for the home. Esteban's father taught him to make bands for pool tables, and thanks to this Esteban started his own business when he had to look for income for his home. 

Currently, Esteban has a shop that despite not being luxurious and not having high tech machines, permits him to generate sufficient income to maintain a dignified quality of life for his family. Esteban has many good clients, and one of these has made a large order for which he needs to buy the raw materials to produce it. Nevertheless, Esteban does not have sufficient capital to make these purchases, which is why he hopes that this loan will offer him the possibility to buy the raw materials he needs to produce the pool bands and complete the order that his client has made. 

Esteban dreams that his business grows and he can modernize his machines, in addition to generating employment and providing his siblings and mother with a good quality of life and economic prosperity.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for the manufacturing of pool table bands

loans.name: Nancy Del Socorro

texts.es:
Nancy es una persona reconocida por tener un gran carisma y siempre estar apoyando a las demás personas. Nancy es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 2 hijos de 16 y 13 años, a los cuales su padre los abandonó hace mucho tiempo. Nancy debe generar los ingresos suficientes para sostener los gastos de su hogar y brindarles una educación a sus 2 hijos, además, Nancy le quiere brindar la posibilidad de acceder a la educación a una sobrina menor que no tiene esta posibilidad debido a que su padre la abandonó y su madre, la hermana de Nancy, se encuentra desempleada. 

Nancy desde pequeña aprendió la actividad de la confección por trascendencia familiar y decidió montar su propio taller de confección, donde ofrece el servicio de la confección a terceros. En este taller Nancy tiene muy buenas ventas, pero tiene el inconveniente de que el techo del taller de confección se está desmoronando debido a que es de madera y tiene un gran desgaste. Nancy requiere repara con urgencia este techo, pues su taller ha estado sin actividad debido al miedo de que este se caiga encima. Nancy, debido a que no cuenta con el dinero para realizar la reparación del techo, espera que un préstamo le permita acceder a reparar el techo del taller de confección y no se caiga, para poder así seguir trabajando en su taller con normalidad.

Nancy sueña con que su taller de confección siga incrementando las ventas, y poder así generar empleo para su familia y las personas que no encuentran oportunidades laborales. Además, sueña con que sus hijos tengan una buena calidad de vida y una prosperidad económica, de modo que no tengan que sufrir las adversidades que pasó ella.
texts.en:
Nancy is a person recognized for having great charisma and she is always helping other people. Nancy is a single mother and head of a family with 2 children, 16 and 13 years old, whose father abandoned them a long time ago. Nancy should generate enough income to support the expenses of her home and provide an education for her two children. Additionally, Nancy wants to provide the possibility of accessing education to her young niece, who doesn't have this possibility given her father abandoned her and her mom, Nancy's sister, finds herself unemployed. 

Nancy learned to sew from her family as a young girl and she decided to open her own sewing workship where she offers sewing services to third parties. In this shop Nancy has very good sales, but has the inconvenience that the roof of the sewing workshiop is crumbling because it is made of wood and has a large leak. Nancy needs to urgently repair the roof, as she has been unable to use the shop due to fear that the roof will fall on her. Nancy, given that she doesn't have the money to perform the roof repair, hopes that this loan will allow her to repair the roof so it doesn't fall and she can continue working in her shop normally. 

Nancy dreams that her sewing workship continues increaseing its sales, and that in this way she can generate employment for her family and other people who can't find employment opporutunities. Additionally, she dreams that her kids have a good quality of life and economic prosperity, so they don't have to suffer the adversities that she has.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her sewing workship

loans.name: Lith

texts.en: Lith is 33 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are in school. For the past two years, she has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan. Lith is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Félix

texts.es:
Félix tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres.

Hace ocho meses el inicio con la instalación de una granja con cinco cerdos y cuando ya están listos los destaza. Él decidió continuar con el trabajo de su papá ya que él esta en silla de ruedas y no puede hacerlo. Antes Félix tenía una panadería, pero decidió realizar otras actividades que le ayuden a mejorar sus ingresos.

Los cerdos los compra de cinco semanas de nacidos, en una ciudad que esta a dos horas del lugar donde vive, el concentrado, alimentos y las vitaminas las compra en el mismo lugar y comercializa la carne de estos en una ciudad que esta a dos horas de su casa. Él tiene buena clientela, les abastece a las vendedoras de carne de una ciudad.

Félix solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo para comprar láminas, cemento, arena, hierro y bloques para construir una galera más. Así él podrá criar más cantidad de cerdos ya que cuando están pequeños los tiene en una galera cuando están en la etapa para ser destazados los traslada a otra, es decir conforme van creciendo los cerdos así él los clasifica en una galera. Con esa inversión su producción será mayor y recibirá mejores ingresos, Félix comenta que se dedicara al 100% a este negocio para que crezca más.
texts.en:
Felix is 26 years old, is single and lives with his parents. 

Eight months ago he began the installation of a farm with five pigs and when they are grown he butchers them. He decided to continue the work of his father who is now in a wheelchair and can't do it. Prior to this, Felix had a bakery, but he decided to other things that would help him to improve his income.

He bought the pigs when they were 5 weeks old, in a city that is two hours away from where lives. He bought the concentrate, food and vitamins in the same place and he sells the meat in a city that is two hours away from his house. He has strong clientel and he supplies the city's sellers with meat. 

Felix asks for a loan from Fundación Campo to buy sheet metal, cement, sand, iron and bricks to construct another pigsty. This way he will be able to raise more pigs so that when they are young he can keep them in one pigsty and when they are at the stage to be butchered he can transfer them to another. As the pigs keep growing he will categorize them by pigsty. With this investment his production will be greater and he will recieve better income. Felix notes that he is 100% dedicated to seeing his business grow more.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, cement, sand, iron and bricks to construct another pigsty

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. Concepcion has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Concepcion has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Concepcion hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Munkhzaya

texts.en: Mrs. Munkhzaya, 29, works as a sales manager in a company that produces vacuum-insulated windows. She has been doing her job for three years and lives with her daughter and her parents in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They own an old house which was built a long time ago. Now it has became old and cold to live in winter. Therefore, she decided to make some urgent renovations to her old house in order to prevent the house from negatively impacting the health of her family members. She will make the repairs in the spring. The loan she is taking out will be used to purchase the building materials to make the renovations to her old house.

loans.use: To purchase the building materials to renovate her old house

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.ru: Равшан целеустремленный и добросовестный человек. Он женат и ответственный отец троих детей. Более 10 лет он занимается приготовлением национальных  блюд, имеет столовую на центральном рынке. Жена помогает мужу по бизнесу. Равшан хочет купить крупный рогатый  скот для бойни. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Ravshan is a goal-oriented and trustworthy person. He is married and is the caring father of three children. For over 10 years he has been cooking traditional national dishes at his eatery located at the central market. His wife helps him in his business. Ravshan wants to buy cattle for meat processing. He hopes for your kind help.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Alba Oliva

texts.es:
Alba es una persona luchadora y trabajadora en la vida, que gracias a estas cualidades ha podido sacar a su esposo y sus 5 hijos adelante. Alba, con 44 años de edad, se encuentra casada y es madre de 5 hijos de los cuales los menores son de 9 y 5 años. Además, Alba de pequeña nunca tuvo el acceso a una educación y ahora esta cursando el penúltimo año del bachillerato. Alba, con su esposo, se dedica a la agricultura, más específicamente al cultivo de arvejas y habichuelas, y gracias a esto generan los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Sin embargo, los ingresos generados con esta actividad no le alcanzan para poder soportar los gastos del hogar, por lo que está en la iniciativa de montar un galpón (pollería) para la crianza de estos y poderlos vender, y tener así una nueva fuente de ingresos. 

Alba, sin embargo, no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la compra de los pollos y la adecuación del galpón, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de materiales para construir el galpón (pollería) y la compra de pollos y su concentrado, para poderlos criar y posteriormente venderlos.

Alba, sueña con que el montaje de este nuevo negocio le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a una mayor fuente de ingresos para poder cubrir a cabalidad todas las necesidades de su hogar. Además, Alba sueña con terminar su bachillerato y con brindarles a sus hijos la posibilidad de acceder a una buena educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Alba is fighter and a hard-worker in life, that thanks to these qualities she has been able to better the lot of her husband and five children.  Alba, at 44 years of age, is married and is a mother to five children of which the youngest are 9 and 5.  In addition, as a child she didn't have access to an education therefore is now in her last year of high school.  She, together with her husband, is a farmer.  They cultivate peas and beans and thanks to this they generate income to maintain the household.  However, the income generated is not enough to support the household expenses, which is why she has taken the initiative to build a chicken coop and buy chickens and feed to be able to raise them and later sell them and in this way have a new source of income.

She, however, does not have the sufficient capital needed to buy the chickens and build an adequate chicken coop.  She hopes that a loan will make it possible to buy the materials necessary to build a chicken coop and buy the chickens and feed to be able to raise them and later sell them.

She dreams that setting up this new business will give her the possibility of a greater source of income to fully cover the needs of the home.  In addition, she dreams of finishing high school to be able to give her children the possibility of a good university education.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a chicken coop, and buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: Diana Maria

texts.es:
Diana es una persona que ha atravesado muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo el gran esfuerzo con el que trabaja todos los días le han permitido salir adelante. Con 34 años de edad, es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 2 hijos de 14 y 6 años, los cuales abandonó su padre hace un tiempo. Diana se desempeña en un restaurante de su región, el cual le permite generar ingresos, pero no son lo suficiente para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar y brindarles una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos.

Es por esto que Diana decidió iniciar el negocio de la venta de mercancía, ya que una hermana suya tiene contactos que le pueden proveer la mercancía a precios muy económicos, y así tendrá un mayor margen de rentabilidad.
Diana espera empezar a vender prendas de vestir como camisetas, pantalones, blusas femeninas, y así poder generar ingresos extras para su hogar. Diana, debido a que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar el surtido de la mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes, tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de prendas de vestir como camisetas, pantalones, blusas entre otros, y poder así ofrecerles a sus clientes una buena cantidad de mercancía.

Diana espera que sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente de esta manera, y así podrá ofrecerles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y unas mayores oportunidades de acceder a una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Diana is a person who has gone through many struggles in her life, yet through great effort and working every day she has been able to get ahead. At 34 years of age, she is a single parent and head of a household of 2 children,14 and 6 years old, who were left by their father a long time ago. Diana works at a restaurant in her area, which allows her to generate income, but not enough to sustain the cost of her home and provide a good quality of life for her children.

That's why Diana decided to start a business of selling goods. Her sister has contacts that can provide the goods at affordable prices, and thus she'll have a higher profit margin.

Diana hopes to start selling clothing such as shirts, pants, and women's blouses, so that she can generate extra income for her home. Because Diana does not have enough capital to acquire the inventory of merchandise to sell to her customers, she hopes that a loan will give her the ability to purchase clothing such as shirts, pants, blouses among others, and thus be able to offer her customers a good deal of merchandise.

Diana expects revenues to increase significantly in this way, so she can offer her children a better life and greater opportunities to access high quality education.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as shirts, pants, blouses and more

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a student applying for a loan to purchase a laptop to assist in her studies at Strathmore University and this is her story:  

I am a second year student at Strathmore University taking a Bachelor's degree in Commerce. I come from a family of five. I have two sisters: the eldest is doing an engineering degree while the other is in primary school. 
My parents are self-employed. It is a real struggle for them to raise money for school fees for my siblings and me. I have had a great passion for joining a university ever since I started schooling. I have a great interest in doing Business and, after a lot of research, I settled on Strathmore University because it has a good reputation and it offers quality education. It is the best business school and I wanted to go to the best.
As I move higher in my studies, a laptop has become an important asset. Currently my parents cannot afford to purchase one for me. A laptop will enhance my studies and make it easier to access notes and other important information both on campus and off campus. It will also make access to my blog easier, and I will be in a position to update it more often.
I would like to advance my studies with a Master's and would also like to start my own business.
My message to the world is to live one day at a time, enjoy life and be happy all the time. We should also grab opportunities as they come, so as not to lose out on something great.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop that will help her conduct research, access the University's e-learning site (e-library), upload assignments and update her blog.

loans.name: Lucely Janeth

texts.es:
Lucelly se ha convertido en una persona que da lo mejor de si en su trabajo con el ánimo de poder sacar adelante su negocio y su familia.
Lucelly se encuentra casada y es madre de 3 hijos de 4, 4 y 8 años de edad, los cuales manifiesta son su principal impulso para hacer las cosas con más dedicación cada día.
Lucelly tiene un taller de confección, donde ofrece el servicio de confección a terceros y se especializa en confeccionar acolchados. Gracias a esta actividad genera los ingresos necesarios para aportar al sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar y permitirles tener una mejor calidad de vida, pues con los ingresos de su esposo no les alcanza para cubrir las necesidades básicas.
Lucelly tiene grandes pedidos por parte de sus clientes, pues sus productos son muy reconocidos por ser de muy buena calidad y porque Lucelly siempre ofrece el mejor servicio y el mejor trato con sus clientes. Debido a esto, Lucelly requiere comprar insumos para elaborar los acolchados para hacer entrega del pedido a sus clientes, pero Lucelly no cuenta actualmente con el dinero suficiente para poder hacer compra de estos insumos. Es por esto que Lucelly espera que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de insumos para la confección de sus acolchados como son telas, hilos, agujas, entre otros, y poder así cumplir con sus pedidos sin afectar sus ingresos mensuales.
Lucelly tiene un gran sueño y es el de poder tener un taller bien grande donde pueda generar empleo y en el cual pueda hacer realidad su sueño de que sus 3 hijos tengan una estabilidad económica que en un futuro les permita acceder a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lucelly has become a person who gives her all to her work in hopes of moving her business and her family forward.  Lucelly is married and the mother of three children who are 4, 4 and 8 years old who she says are her main impulse to do things with more dedication every day.

Lucelly has a sewing workshop where she makes items for third persons; her specialty is quilts.  Thanks to this activity she’s able to generate the necessary income to help cover household expenses and to be able to have a better quality of life because her husband’s income isn’t enough to cover basic needs.

Lucelly has large pending customer orders because her products are very well known because they are of very good quality and because Lucelly always provides the best service and best treatment to her customers.  Because of this, Lucelly needs to buy raw materials to make the quilts in order to fill customer orders but Lucelly does not currently have enough money to purchase said materials so is hoping for a loan that will allow her to buy the supplies she needs to make the quilts such as fabric, thread and needles, among others, to be able to fill her orders without affecting her monthly income.

Lucelly’s great dream is to be able to have a large workshop where she can generate employment and make her dream come true of providing economic stability for her three children so that in future they can have access to a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Mche

texts.en:
Mche is 57 years old. She is a widow with six children aged between 10 and 20 years. She describes herself as a resilient woman. Previously, she was involved in a greengrocer business, and for the past 20 years she has been running a restaurant in addition to the greengrocer. She sells tea, food, snacks, etc. 

She describes her place of operation as viable and busy. Her primary customers are repeat and walk-ins. Currently, she has three employees. She describes her business challenge to be the high prices of ingredients used in preparing food and tea. She will be using the loan of KES 10,000 to buy more vegetables and fruits for her grocery store. 

In the next five years, Mche's hope and dream is to run a big hotel in her nearby town. She plans to use the profits and proceeds from the business to educate her children to university.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits for her grocery store.

loans.name: Luz Fatima

texts.es:
Luz Fatima se ha caracterizado por ser una persona que siempre ha buscado una mejor calidad de vida para su familia. Luz Fatima vive con su esposo desde hace aproximadamente 13 años, y con el inicio el negocio de una tienda donde vende productos de confitería y cervezas. 
Luz Fatima tuvo que atravesar muchas adversidades en su vida, lo cual ha hecho que quiera que su familia no tenga que pasar por las mismas.

El negocio que tiene ha tenido muy buenas ventas, por lo que Luz Fatima ha podido colaborar a su esposo en las obligaciones del hogar. 
Debido a que no tiene mucho capital, su negocio no tiene mucho surtido, y sus clientes le han pedido productos que ella no tiene en su tienda, es por esto que ha visto como pierde clientes poco a poco. Con el ánimo de cambiar esta situación Luz Fatima quiere surtir su negocio, para lo que requiere comprar mercancía, sin embargo, no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para realizar estas compras por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de confitería y cervezas para surtir su tienda general, y de esta manera poder atender todas las necesidades de sus clientes.

Luz Fatima espera que con la compra de estos productos, sus clientes aumenten considerablemente, debido a que ya encontrarán más productos con los cuales satisfacer sus necesidades. Luz Fatima sueña con que ella y su esposo puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Luz Fatima has been characterized as a person who has always sought a better life for her family. Luz lives with her husband of about 13 years, and started her business in a shop selling confectionery goods and beer.

Luz Fatima went through many hardships in her life, and she doesn't want her family to have go through the same hardships.

The business has had very good sales, so Luz Fatima has been able to share the household duties with her husband.

Because she does not have much capital, her business does not have much variety. Her customers have asked for products that she does not have in her store, which is why losing customers little by little. In an effort to change this Luz Fatima wants to buy more varied goods for her business, which requires the purchase of merchandise. However, she does not have enough money to make these purchases so she hopes that a loan will give her the opportunity to access the purchase of confectionery goods and beer to fill her general store, and thus be able to meet all the needs of her customers.

Luz Fatima hopes that with the purchase of these products, her customers will increase considerably, because they will find more products which meet their needs. Luz Fatima dreams that she and her husband can have a better quality of life and economic stability.

loans.use: buy confectionery goods and beer to fill her general store

loans.name: Luz Ofelia

texts.es:
Luz Ofelia se ha caracterizado por ser una emprendedora de toda la vida que siempre tiene ideas innovadoras para crear. Casada y madre de 2 hijos, Luz Ofelia se dedica a la actividad de la confección de productos para mascotas, como son collares, casas, vestidos, entre otros, y gracias a esto ayuda a generar junto con su esposo los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Luz Ofelia ha visto como sus ventas han incrementado considerablemente, pues desde que abrió su negocio, sus productos han sido reconocidos por la buena calidad de los mismos. 

Luz Ofelia actualmente tiene un buen nivel de ventas y quiere seguirlo aumentando. Es por esto que ahora está sacando un nuevo producto que es una mochila en donde transportar a las mascotas en caso de salir de la casa, y este producto ya tiene grandes pedidos por parte de sus clientes. Como Luz Ofelia no cuenta con un capital suficiente para comprar la materia prima que necesita para la fabricación de estos productos, tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de materias primas como telas, hilos, cremalleras, entre otros, y poder fabricar el producto y entregar los pedidos a sus clientes.

Luz Ofelia sueña con que su negocio crezca y cada vez sea más reconocido, además, de poder abrir un punto de venta al público. Luz Ofelia sueña con que sus hijos y su esposo puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida, y en un futuro, quiere poderles brindar a sus hijos la posibilidad de acceder a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Luz Ofelia has been an entrepreneur all of her life.  She always has innovative ideas to actualize.  She is married and has two children.  Luz Ofelia makes pet products like collars, houses, clothes, and others.  Thanks to this she helps generate, along with her husband, the income needed to support the household expenses.

Luz Ofelia has seen how her sales have increased considerably since she opened her business.  Her products have been recognized for their good quality.  Luz Ofelia currently has a good level of sales, and she wants it to continue increasing.  That is why she is now bringing out a new product, a backpack for transporting pets when leaving home.  There are already large customer orders for this product.

Luz Ofelia does not have enough capital to buy the raw material she needs to make these products.  She hopes that a loan will give her the opportunity to buy raw materials like fabric, thread, zippers, and others.  Then she will be able to make the product and deliver the orders to her customers.

Luz Ofelia dreams of her business growing and becoming more well-known.  She also dreams of being able to open a spot to sell to the public.  Luz Ofelia dreams that her children and her husband will be able to have a better quality of life.  In the future she wants to be able to give her children the opportunity of a university education.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like fabric, thread, zippers, and others.

loans.name: Neville

texts.en:
Neville is a student applying for a loan to purchase a laptop to assist in his studies at Strathmore University and this is his story: 

I live in a family of six siblings. I am in year one of my Bachelor of Commerce degree. I have a strong passion for IT and programming, which I am studying on my own.

Strathmore University undoubtedly offers the best quality in Kenya's higher education. That is why it is my university of choice. In many ways, this laptop loan will aid in the realization of my dream to become an established programmer and IT guru. Furthermore, it will see me through to contribute to the advancement of education in IT and probably create jobs for the many jobless Kenyans.

I am self-driven and highly motivated with big dreams and great passion for learning and creating new things. I also love charity work and – God willing, if my dreams come true – I would like to be a major contributor to Kiva loans to extend the help offered to the needy and less fortunate around the world. Owning a laptop will be a milestone towards achieving this dream.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop that will assist in his Information Technology studies so he can realize his dream of becoming a programming guru and entrepreneur.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a student applying for a loan to purchase a laptop to assist in her studies at Strathmore University and this is her story: 

My family consists of five people. I am the first born; I have one sister, one brother and both parents. I decided to purse university education so that I could gain the necessary skills and knowledge required to compete at the higher levels of the job market. This is so I can achieve my long-term dream of being the best that I can be.

I chose Strathmore University because of the quality of education offered and the opportunities that one is exposed to at the university. The main reason I need this loan to purchase a laptop is so I can finish my final year project on time. The laptop will give me flexibility in working on the project.
